</td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;border-top:#aaa 1px solid">\n         <a href="/wiki/Lists_of_United_States_state_symbols" title="Lists of United States state symbols">\n          Lists of United States state symbols\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       <b>\n        Texas\n       </b>\n       (\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt">\n         <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">\n          /\n          <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">\n           <span title="/\xcb\x88/: primary stress follows">\n            \xcb\x88\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'t\' in \'tie\'">\n            t\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x9b/: \'e\' in \'dress\'">\n            \xc9\x9b\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'k\' in \'kind\'">\n            k\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'s\' in \'sigh\'">\n            s\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x99/: \'a\' in \'about\'">\n            \xc9\x99\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'s\' in \'sigh\'">\n            s\n           </span>\n          </span>\n          /\n         </a>\n        </span>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <small>\n         locally\n        </small>\n        <span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt">\n         <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">\n          /\n          <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">\n           <span title="/\xcb\x88/: primary stress follows">\n            \xcb\x88\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'t\' in \'tie\'">\n            t\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x9b/: \'e\' in \'dress\'">\n            \xc9\x9b\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'k\' in \'kind\'">\n            k\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'s\' in \'sigh\'">\n            s\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x99/: \'a\' in \'about\'">\n            \xc9\x99\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'z\' in \'zoom\'">\n            z\n           </span>\n          </span>\n          /\n         </a>\n        </span>\n       </span>\n       ;\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_language" title="Spanish language">\n        Spanish\n       </a>\n       :\n       <span lang="es">\n        <i>\n         Texas or Tejas\n        </i>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <small>\n        pronounced\n       </small>\n       <span class="IPA" title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)">\n        <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">\n         [\xcb\x88texas]\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       ) is the second largest\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">\n        state\n       </a>\n       in the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">\n        United States\n       </a>\n       by both\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_and_territories_by_area" title="List of U.S. states and territories by area">\n        area\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_and_territories_by_population" title="List of U.S. states and territories by population">\n        population\n       </a>\n       . Geographically located in the\n       <a href="/wiki/South_Central_United_States" title="South Central United States">\n        South Central region\n       </a>\n       of the country, Texas shares borders with the U.S. states of\n       <a href="/wiki/Louisiana" title="Louisiana">\n        Louisiana\n       </a>\n       to the east,\n       <a href="/wiki/Arkansas" title="Arkansas">\n        Arkansas\n       </a>\n       to the northeast,\n       <a href="/wiki/Oklahoma" title="Oklahoma">\n        Oklahoma\n       </a>\n       to the north,\n       <a href="/wiki/New_Mexico" title="New Mexico">\n        New Mexico\n       </a>\n       to the west, and the\n       <a href="/wiki/States_of_Mexico" title="States of Mexico">\n        Mexican states\n       </a>\n       of\n       <a href="/wiki/Chihuahua_(state)" title="Chihuahua (state)">\n        Chihuahua\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Coahuila" title="Coahuila">\n        Coahuila\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Nuevo_Le%C3%B3n" title="Nuevo Le\xc3\xb3n">\n        Nuevo Le\xc3\xb3n\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Tamaulipas" title="Tamaulipas">\n        Tamaulipas\n       </a>\n       to the southwest, while the\n       <a href="/wiki/Gulf_of_Mexico" title="Gulf of Mexico">\n        Gulf of Mexico\n       </a>\n       is to the southeast.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">\n        Houston\n       </a>\n       is the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Texas_by_population" title="List of cities in Texas by population">\n        most populous city\n       </a>\n       in Texas and the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">\n        fourth largest\n       </a>\n       in the U.S., while\n       <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio" title="San Antonio">\n        San Antonio\n       </a>\n       is the second most populous in the state and seventh largest in the U.S.\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas%E2%80%93Fort_Worth_metroplex" title="Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth metroplex">\n        Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Greater_Houston" title="Greater Houston">\n        Greater Houston\n       </a>\n       are the fourth and fifth largest\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">\n        metropolitan statistical areas\n       </a>\n       in the country, respectively. Other major cities include\n       <a href="/wiki/Austin,_Texas" title="Austin, Texas">\n        Austin\n       </a>\n       , the second most populous\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_capitals_in_the_United_States" title="List of capitals in the United States">\n        state capital\n       </a>\n       in the U.S., and\n       <a href="/wiki/El_Paso,_Texas" title="El Paso, Texas">\n        El Paso\n       </a>\n       . Texas is nicknamed "The Lone Star State" to signify its former status as an independent republic, and as a reminder of the state\'s struggle for independence from\n       <a href="/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">\n        Mexico\n       </a>\n       . The "Lone Star" can be found on the Texas state flag and on the Texan state seal.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9">\n        <a href="#cite_note-9">\n         [9]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The origin of Texas\'s name is from the word "Tejas," which means "friends" in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Caddo" title="Caddo">\n        Caddo\n       </a>\n       language.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10">\n        <a href="#cite_note-10">\n         [10]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Due to its size and geologic features such as the\n       <a href="/wiki/Balcones_Fault" title="Balcones Fault">\n        Balcones Fault\n       </a>\n       , Texas contains diverse\n       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Texas" title="Geography of Texas">\n        landscapes\n       </a>\n       that resemble both the U.S.\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n        Southern\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Southwestern_United_States" title="Southwestern United States">\n        Southwestern regions\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11">\n        <a href="#cite_note-11">\n         [11]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Although Texas is popularly associated with the U.S.\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_North_American_deserts" title="List of North American deserts">\n        southwestern deserts\n       </a>\n       , less than 10% of Texas\' land area is\n       <a href="/wiki/Desert" title="Desert">\n        desert\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">\n        <a href="#cite_note-12">\n         [12]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Most of the population centers are located in areas of former\n       <a href="/wiki/Prairie" title="Prairie">\n        prairies\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Grassland" title="Grassland">\n        grasslands\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Piney_woods" title="Piney woods">\n        forests\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Coastline" title="Coastline">\n        coastline\n       </a>\n       . Traveling from east to west, one can observe terrain that ranges from coastal\n       <a href="/wiki/Swamp" title="Swamp">\n        swamps\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Piney_woods" title="Piney woods">\n        piney woods\n       </a>\n       , to rolling plains and rugged hills, and finally the\n       <a href="/wiki/Desert" title="Desert">\n        desert\n       </a>\n       and mountains of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Big_Bend_(Texas)" title="Big Bend (Texas)">\n        Big Bend\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The term "\n       <a href="/wiki/Six_flags_over_Texas" title="Six flags over Texas">\n        six flags over Texas\n       </a>\n       "\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13">\n        <a href="#cite_note-13">\n         [note 1]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       refers to several nations that have ruled over the territory. Spain was the\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Texas" title="Spanish Texas">\n        first European country to claim the area\n       </a>\n       of Texas. France held a\n       <a href="/wiki/French_colonization_of_Texas" title="French colonization of Texas">\n        short-lived colony\n       </a>\n       . Mexico controlled the territory until 1836 when Texas won its independence, becoming an independent\n       <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Texas" title="Republic of Texas">\n        Republic\n       </a>\n       . In 1845,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14">\n        <a href="#cite_note-14">\n         [13]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas joined the union as the 28th state. The state\'s\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Texas_Annexation" title="Texas Annexation">\n        annexation\n       </a>\n       set off a chain of events that led to the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mexican%E2%80%93American_War" title="Mexican\xe2\x80\x93American War">\n        Mexican\xe2\x80\x93American War\n       </a>\n       in 1846. A\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Slave_and_free_states" title="Slave and free states">\n        slave state\n       </a>\n       before the\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Civil_War" title="American Civil War">\n        American Civil War\n       </a>\n       , Texas declared its secession from the U.S. in early 1861, and officially joined the\n       <a href="/wiki/Confederate_States_of_America" title="Confederate States of America">\n        Confederate States of America\n       </a>\n       on March 2 of the same year. After the Civil War and the restoration of its representation in the federal government, Texas entered a long period of economic stagnation.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Historically four major industries shaped the Texas economy prior to\n       <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">\n        World War II\n       </a>\n       : cattle and bison, cotton, timber, and oil.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15">\n        <a href="#cite_note-15">\n         [14]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Before and after the U.S. Civil War the cattle industry, which Texas came to dominate, was a major economic driver for the state, thus creating the traditional image of the Texas cowboy. In the later 19th century cotton and lumber grew to be major industries as the cattle industry became less lucrative. It was ultimately, though, the discovery of major\n       <a href="/wiki/Petroleum" title="Petroleum">\n        petroleum\n       </a>\n       deposits (\n       <a href="/wiki/Spindletop" title="Spindletop">\n        Spindletop\n       </a>\n       in particular) that initiated an\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_oil_boom" title="Texas oil boom">\n        economic boom\n       </a>\n       which became the driving force behind the economy for much of the 20th century. With strong investments in universities, Texas developed a diversified\n       <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Texas" title="Economy of Texas">\n        economy\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/High_tech" title="High tech">\n        high tech\n       </a>\n       industry in the mid-20th century. As of 2015, it is second on the list of the most\n       <a href="/wiki/Fortune_500" title="Fortune 500">\n        Fortune 500\n       </a>\n       companies with 54.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16">\n        <a href="#cite_note-16">\n         [15]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       With a growing base of industry, the state leads in many industries, including agriculture,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Petrochemicals" title="Petrochemicals">\n        petrochemicals\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Energy_industry" title="Energy industry">\n        energy\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Computer_industry" title="Computer industry">\n        computers\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Consumer_electronics" title="Consumer electronics">\n        electronics\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Aerospace" title="Aerospace">\n        aerospace\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Medical_research" title="Medical research">\n        biomedical sciences\n       </a>\n       . Texas has led the nation in state export revenue since 2002, and has the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_by_GDP" title="List of U.S. states by GDP">\n        second-highest\n       </a>\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gross_State_Product" title="Gross State Product">\n        gross state product\n       </a>\n       . If it were a country, Texas would be the\n       <a href="/wiki/Comparison_between_U.S._states_and_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="Comparison between U.S. states and countries by GDP (nominal)">\n        10th largest economy in the world\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n      </p>\n      <div class="toc" id="toc">\n       <div class="toctitle">\n        <h2>\n         Contents\n        </h2>\n       </div>\n       <ul>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1">\n         <a href="#Etymology">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           1\n          </span>\n </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-4">\n           <a href="#Wildlife">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Wildlife\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-5">\n           Storms\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-7">\n           <a href="#Greenhouse_gases">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n <span class="toctext">\n             Civil War and Reconstruction (1860\xe2\x80\x931900)\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-14">\n           <a href="#Earlier_20th_century">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.6\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Earlier 20th century\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-15">\n           <a href="#Economic_and_political_change_.281950.E2.80.93present.29">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.7\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Economic and political change (1950\xe2\x80\x93present)\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-16">\n         <a href="#Government_and_politics">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           5\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Government and politics\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-17">\n           <a   </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-18">\n           <a href="#Politics">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Politics\n            </span>\n           </a>\n           <ul>\n            <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-19">\n             <a href="#Political_history">\n              <span class="tocnumber">\n               5.2.1\n              </span>\n              <span class="toctext">\n               Political history\n              </span>\n             </a>\n            </li>\n            <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-20">\n             <a href="#Texas_politics_today">\n              <span class="tocnumber">\n               5.2.2\n              </span>\n              <span class="toctext">\n               Texas politics today\n              </span>\n             </a>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-21">\n           <a href="#Administrative_divisions">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Administrative divisions\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-22">\n           <a href="#Criminal_law">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Criminal law\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-23">\n         <a href="#Economy">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           6\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Economy\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-24">\n           <a href="#Taxation">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             6.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Taxation\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-25">\n           <a href="#Agriculture_and_mining">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             6.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Agriculture and mining\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-26">\n           <a href="#Energy">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             6.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Energy\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-27">\n           <a href="#Technology">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             6.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Technology\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-28">\n           <a href="#Commerce">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             6.5\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Commerce\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-29">\n         <a href="#Demographics">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           7\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Demographics\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30">\n           <a href="#Ethnicity">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             7.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Ethnicity\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-31">\n           <a href="#Cities_and_towns">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             7.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Cities and towns\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-32">\n           <a href="#Languages">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             7.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Languages\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-33">\n           <a href="#Religion">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             7.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Religion\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-34">\n         <a href="#Culture">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           8\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Culture\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-35">\n           <a href="#Texas_self-perception">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             8.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Texas self-perception\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-36">\n           <a href="#Arts">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             8.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Arts\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-37">\n         <a href="#Education">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           9\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Education\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-38">\n           <a href="#Higher_education">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             9.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Higher education\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-39">\n         <a href="#Media">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           10\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Media\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-40">\n         <a href="#Healthcare">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           11\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Healthcare\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-41">\n           <a href="#Medical_research">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             11.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Medical research\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-42">\n         <a href="#Transportation">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           12\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Transportation\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-43">\n           <a href="#Highways">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             12.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Highways\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-44">\n           <a href="#Airports">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             12.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Airports\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-45">\n           <a href="#Ports">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             12.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Ports\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-46">\n           <a href="#Railroads">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             12.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Railroads\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-47">\n         <a href="#Sports">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           13\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Sports\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-48">\n         <a href="#See_also">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           14\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           See also\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-49">\n         <a href="#Notes">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           15\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Notes\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-50">\n         <a href="#References">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           16\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           References\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-51">\n         <a href="#Bibliography">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           17\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Bibliography\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-52">\n         <a href="#External_links">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           18\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           External links\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n       </ul>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">\n        Etymology\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <p>\n       The name Texas, based on the\n       <a href="/wiki/Caddo_language" title="Caddo language">\n        Caddo\n       </a>\n       word\n       <i>\n        tejas\n       </i>\n       meaning "friends" or "allies", was applied by the Spanish to the\n       <a href="/wiki/Caddo" title="Caddo">\n        Caddo\n       </a>\n       themselves and to the region of their settlement in\n       <a href="/wiki/East_Texas" title="East Texas">\n        East Texas\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TribesofTexas_17-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TribesofTexas-17">\n         [16]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       During Spanish colonial rule, the area was officially known as the\n       <i>\n        Nuevo Reino de Filipinas: La Provincia de Texas\n       </i>\n       (English: New Kingdom of the Philippines: The Province of Texas).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18">\n        <a href="#cite_note-18">\n         [17]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">\n        Geography\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Texas" title="Geography of Texas">\n        Geography of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1140" data-file-width="1711" height="167" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg/250px-Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg/375px-Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg/500px-Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Sam_Rayburn_Reservoir" title="Sam Rayburn Reservoir">\n          Sam Rayburn Reservoir\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1125" data-file-width="1500" height="188" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG/250px-Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG/375px-Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG/500px-Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Texas_Hill_Country_187N-2.JPG" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Texas_Hill_Country" title="Texas Hill Country">\n          Texas Hill Country\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Texas is the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_and_territories_by_area" title="List of U.S. states and territories by area">\n        second largest\n       </a>\n       U.S. state, after\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n        Alaska\n       </a>\n       , with an area of 268,820 square miles (696,200\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ). Though 10%\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_area" title="List of countries by area">\n        larger than France\n       </a>\n       and almost twice as large as Germany or Japan, it ranks only 27th worldwide amongst\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_the_largest_country_subdivisions_by_area" title="List of the largest country subdivisions by area">\n        country subdivisions by size\n       </a>\n       . If it were an independent country, Texas would be the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_area" title="List of countries by area">\n        40th largest\n       </a>\n       behind\n       <a href="/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">\n        Chile\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Zambia" title="Zambia">\n        Zambia\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas is in the\n       <a href="/wiki/South_Central_United_States" title="South Central United States">\n        south central\n       </a>\n       part of the United States of America. Three of its borders are defined by rivers. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Rio_Grande" title="Rio Grande">\n        Rio Grande\n       </a>\n       forms a natural border with the Mexican states of\n       <a href="/wiki/Chihuahua_(state)" title="Chihuahua (state)">\n        Chihuahua\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Coahuila" title="Coahuila">\n        Coahuila\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Nuevo_Le%C3%B3n" title="Nuevo Le\xc3\xb3n">\n        Nuevo Le\xc3\xb3n\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Tamaulipas" title="Tamaulipas">\n        Tamaulipas\n       </a>\n       to the south. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Red_River_of_the_South" title="Red River of the South">\n        Red River\n       </a>\n       forms a natural border with Oklahoma and Arkansas to the north. The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sabine_River_(Texas-Louisiana)" title="Sabine River (Texas-Louisiana)">\n        Sabine River\n       </a>\n       forms a natural border with Louisiana to the east. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Panhandle" title="Texas Panhandle">\n        Texas Panhandle\n       </a>\n       has an eastern border with Oklahoma at\n       <a href="/wiki/100th_meridian_west" title="100th meridian west">\n        100\xc2\xb0 W\n       </a>\n       , a northern border with Oklahoma at\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Parallel_36%C2%B030%27_north" title="Parallel 36\xc2\xb030\' north">\n        36\xc2\xb030\' N\n       </a>\n       and a western border with New Mexico at\n       <a href="/wiki/103rd_meridian_west" title="103rd meridian west">\n        103\xc2\xb0 W\n       </a>\n       .\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/El_Paso" title="El Paso">\n        El Paso\n       </a>\n       lies on the state\'s western tip at\n       <a href="/wiki/32nd_parallel_north" title="32nd parallel north">\n        32\xc2\xb0 N\n       </a>\n       and the Rio Grande.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-comp1850_19-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-comp1850-19">\n         [18]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       With 10\n       <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="K\xc3\xb6ppen climate classification">\n        climatic regions\n       </a>\n       , 14\n       <a href="/wiki/Agricultural_soil_science" title="Agricultural soil science">\n        soil regions\n       </a>\n       and 11 distinct\n       <a href="/wiki/Ecoregion" title="Ecoregion">\n        ecological regions\n       </a>\n       , regional classification becomes problematic with differences in soils, topography, geology, rainfall, and plant and animal communities.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Tx_eco_regions_20-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Tx_eco_regions-20">\n         [19]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       One classification system divides Texas, in order from southeast to west, into the following:\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gulf_Coastal_Plains" title="Gulf Coastal Plains">\n        Gulf Coastal Plains\n       </a>\n       , Interior Lowlands,\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Plains" title="Great Plains">\n        Great Plains\n       </a>\n       , and Basin and Range Province.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The Gulf Coastal Plains region wraps around the Gulf of Mexico on the southeast section of the state. Vegetation in this region consists of thick piney woods. The Interior Lowlands region consists of gently rolling to hilly forested land and is part of a larger pine-hardwood forest.\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:272px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1153" data-file-width="1500" height="208" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/97/Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg/270px-Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/97/Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg/405px-Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/97/Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg/540px-Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg 2x" width="270"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Lake_Alan_Henry.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Lake_Alan_Henry" title="Lake Alan Henry">\n          Lake Alan Henry\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1605" data-file-width="2100" height="191" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg/250px-Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg/375px-Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg/500px-Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Martin-Dies-Jr-State-Park.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Steinhagen_Reservoir" title="Steinhagen Reservoir">\n          Steinhagen Reservoir\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The Great Plains region in central Texas is located in spans through the state\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Panhandle" title="Texas Panhandle">\n        panhandle\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Llano_Estacado" title="Llano Estacado">\n        Llano Estacado\n       </a>\n       to the state\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Hill_Country" title="Texas Hill Country">\n        hill country\n       </a>\n       near Austin. This region is dominated by\n       <a href="/wiki/Prairie" title="Prairie">\n        prairie\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Steppe" title="Steppe">\n        steppe\n       </a>\n       . "Far West Texas" or the "\n       <a href="/wiki/Trans-Pecos" title="Trans-Pecos">\n        Trans-Pecos\n       </a>\n       " region is the state\'s Basin and Range Province. The most varied of the regions, this area includes Sand Hills, the Stockton Plateau, desert valleys, wooded mountain slopes and desert grasslands.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas has 3,700 named streams and 15 major rivers,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21">\n        <a href="#cite_note-21">\n         [20]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">\n        <a href="#cite_note-22">\n         [21]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       with the\n       <a href="/wiki/Rio_Grande" title="Rio Grande">\n        Rio Grande\n       </a>\n       as the largest. Other major rivers include the\n       <a href="/wiki/Pecos_River" title="Pecos River">\n        Pecos\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Brazos_River" title="Brazos River">\n        Brazos\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Colorado_River_(Texas)" title="Colorado River (Texas)">\n        Colorado\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Red_River_of_the_South" title="Red River of the South">\n        Red River\n       </a>\n       . While Texas has few natural lakes, Texans have built over 100\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_lakes_in_Texas" title="List of lakes in Texas">\n        artificial reservoirs\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23">\n        <a href="#cite_note-23">\n         [22]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The size and unique history of Texas make its regional affiliation debatable; it can be fairly considered a Southern or a Southwestern state, or both. The vast geographic, economic, and cultural diversity within the state itself prohibits easy categorization of the whole state into a\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_regions_of_the_United_States" title="List of regions of the United States">\n        recognized region of the United States\n       </a>\n       . Notable extremes range from\n       <a href="/wiki/East_Texas" title="East Texas">\n        East Texas\n       </a>\n       which is often considered an extension of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Deep_South" title="Deep South">\n        Deep South\n       </a>\n       , to\n       <a href="/wiki/Trans-Pecos" title="Trans-Pecos">\n        Far West Texas\n       </a>\n       which is generally acknowledged to be part of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southwestern_United_States" title="Southwestern United States">\n        interior Southwest\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24">\n        <a href="#cite_note-24">\n         [23]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geology">\n        Geology\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Geology_of_Texas" title="Geology of Texas">\n        Geology of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1944" data-file-width="2592" height="188" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG/250px-Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG/375px-Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG/500px-Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Palo_Duro_landscape_IMG_0101.JPG" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Palo_Duro_Canyon" title="Palo Duro Canyon">\n          Palo Duro Canyon\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="640" height="188" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg/250px-Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg/375px-Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg/500px-Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Summitanthonysnose1b.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Franklin_Mountains_State_Park" title="Franklin Mountains State Park">\n          Franklin Mountains State Park\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1712" data-file-width="2288" height="187" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg/250px-Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg/375px-Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg/500px-Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Big_Bend_National_Park_PB112599.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Big_Bend_National_Park" title="Big Bend National Park">\n          Big Bend National Park\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Texas is the southernmost part of the Great Plains, which ends in the south against the folded\n       <a href="/wiki/Sierra_Madre_Occidental" title="Sierra Madre Occidental">\n        Sierra Madre Occidental\n       </a>\n       of Mexico. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Continental_crust" title="Continental crust">\n        continental crust\n       </a>\n       forms a stable\n       <a href="/wiki/Mesoproterozoic" title="Mesoproterozoic">\n        Mesoproterozoic\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Craton" title="Craton">\n        craton\n       </a>\n       which changes across a broad continental margin and transitional crust into true\n       <a href="/wiki/Oceanic_crust" title="Oceanic crust">\n        oceanic crust\n       </a>\n       of the Gulf of Mexico. The oldest rocks in Texas date from the Mesoproterozoic and are about 1,600 million years old.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       These\n       <a href="/wiki/Precambrian" title="Precambrian">\n        Precambrian\n       </a>\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Igneous" title="Igneous">\n        igneous\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Metamorphic_rock" title="Metamorphic rock">\n        metamorphic rocks\n       </a>\n       underlie most of the state, and are exposed in three places:\n       <a href="/wiki/Llano,_Texas" title="Llano, Texas">\n        Llano\n       </a>\n       uplift,\n       <a href="/wiki/Van_Horn,_Texas" title="Van Horn, Texas">\n        Van Horn\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Franklin_Mountains_(Texas)" title="Franklin Mountains (Texas)">\n        Franklin Mountains\n       </a>\n       , near El Paso.\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sedimentary_rocks" title="Sedimentary rocks">\n        Sedimentary rocks\n       </a>\n       overlay most of these ancient rocks. The oldest sediments were deposited on the flanks of a rifted continental margin, or\n       <a href="/wiki/Passive_margin" title="Passive margin">\n        passive margin\n       </a>\n       that developed during\n       <a href="/wiki/Cambrian" title="Cambrian">\n        Cambrian\n       </a>\n       time.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       This margin existed until\n       <a href="/wiki/Laurasia" title="Laurasia">\n        Laurasia\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Gondwana" title="Gondwana">\n        Gondwana\n       </a>\n       collided in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Pennsylvanian_(geology)" title="Pennsylvanian (geology)">\n        Pennsylvanian\n       </a>\n       subperiod to form\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pangea" title="Pangea">\n        Pangea\n       </a>\n       . This is the buried crest of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Appalachian_Mountains" title="Appalachian Mountains">\n        Appalachian Mountains\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x93\n       <a href="/wiki/Ouachita_Mountains" title="Ouachita Mountains">\n        Ouachita Mountains\n       </a>\n       zone of Pennsylvanian\n       <a href="/wiki/Continental_collision" title="Continental collision">\n        continental collision\n       </a>\n       . This\n       <a href="/wiki/Orogeny" title="Orogeny">\n        orogenic\n       </a>\n       crest is today buried beneath the Dallas\xe2\x80\x93\n       <a href="/wiki/Waco,_Texas" title="Waco, Texas">\n        Waco\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94Austin\xe2\x80\x93San Antonio trend.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The late\n       <a href="/wiki/Paleozoic" title="Paleozoic">\n        Paleozoic\n       </a>\n       mountains collapsed as\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rifting" title="Rifting">\n        rifting\n       </a>\n       in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Jurassic" title="Jurassic">\n        Jurassic\n       </a>\n       period began to open the Gulf of Mexico. Pangea began to break up in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Triassic" title="Triassic">\n        Triassic\n       </a>\n       , but\n       <a href="/wiki/Seafloor_spreading" title="Seafloor spreading">\n        seafloor spreading\n       </a>\n       to form the Gulf of Mexico occurred only in the mid and\n       <a href="/wiki/Late_Jurassic" title="Late Jurassic">\n        late Jurassic\n       </a>\n       . The shoreline shifted again to the eastern margin of the state and the Gulf of Mexico passive margin began to form. Today 9 to 12 miles (14 to 19\xc2\xa0km) of sediments are buried beneath the Texas continental shelf and a large proportion of remaining US\n       <a href="/wiki/Oil_reserves" title="Oil reserves">\n        oil reserves\n       </a>\n       are located here. At the start of its formation, the incipient Gulf of Mexico basin was restricted and seawater often evaporated completely to form thick\n       <a href="/wiki/Evaporite" title="Evaporite">\n        evaporite\n       </a>\n       deposits of Jurassic age. These salt deposits formed\n       <a href="/wiki/Salt_dome" title="Salt dome">\n        salt dome\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Diapir" title="Diapir">\n        diapirs\n       </a>\n       , and are found in East Texas along the Gulf coast.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DiaperGrowth_25-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DiaperGrowth-25">\n         [24]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       East Texas outcrops consist of\n       <a href="/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">\n        Cretaceous\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Paleogene" title="Paleogene">\n        Paleogene\n       </a>\n       sediments which contain important deposits of\n       <a href="/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">\n        Eocene\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Lignite" title="Lignite">\n        lignite\n       </a>\n       . The Mississippian and Pennsylvanian sediments in the north; Permian sediments in the west; and Cretaceous sediments in the east, along the Gulf coast and out on the Texas\n       <a href="/wiki/Continental_shelf" title="Continental shelf">\n        continental shelf\n       </a>\n       contain oil.\n       <a href="/wiki/Oligocene" title="Oligocene">\n        Oligocene\n       </a>\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Volcanic" title="Volcanic">\n        volcanic\n       </a>\n       rocks are found in far west Texas in the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Big_Bend,_Texas" title="Big Bend, Texas">\n        Big Bend\n       </a>\n       area. A blanket of\n       <a href="/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">\n        Miocene\n       </a>\n       sediments known as the\n       <a href="/wiki/Ogallala_Aquifer" title="Ogallala Aquifer">\n        Ogallala formation\n       </a>\n       in the western high plains region is an important\n       <a href="/wiki/Aquifer" title="Aquifer">\n        aquifer\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Ogallala_26-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Ogallala-26">\n         [25]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Located far from an active\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Plate_tectonic" title="Plate tectonic">\n        plate tectonic\n       </a>\n       boundary, Texas has no\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Volcanoes" title="Volcanoes">\n        volcanoes\n       </a>\n       and few earthquakes.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-earthquakes_27-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-earthquakes-27">\n         [26]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Wildlife">\n        Wildlife\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_mammals_of_Texas" title="List of mammals of Texas">\n        List of mammals of Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Texas" title="List of birds of Texas">\n        List of birds of Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_reptiles_of_Texas" title="List of reptiles of Texas">\n        List of reptiles of Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_amphibians_of_Texas" title="List of amphibians of Texas">\n        List of amphibians of Texas\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_taxa_described_from_Texas" title="List of taxa described from Texas">\n        List of taxa described from Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       A wide range of animals and insects live in Texas. It is the home to 65 species of mammals, 213 species of reptiles and amphibians, and the greatest diversity of bird life in the United States\xe2\x80\x94590 native species in all.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28">\n        <a href="#cite_note-28">\n         [27]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       At least 12 species have been introduced and now reproduce freely in Texas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-29">\n        <a href="#cite_note-29">\n         [28]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas plays host to several species of wasps. Texas is one of the regions that has the highest abundance of\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Polistes_exclamans" title="Polistes exclamans">\n         Polistes exclamans\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Range_Extension_30-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Range_Extension-30">\n         [29]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Additionally, Texas has provided an important ground for the study of\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Polistes_annularis" title="Polistes annularis">\n         Polistes annularis\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       During the spring Texas\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Wildflowers" title="Wildflowers">\n        wildflowers\n       </a>\n       such as the state flower, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Lupinus_texensis" title="Lupinus texensis">\n        bluebonnet\n       </a>\n       , line highways throughout Texas. During the Johnson Administration the first lady,\n       <a href="/wiki/Lady_Bird_Johnson" title="Lady Bird Johnson">\n        Lady Bird Johnson\n       </a>\n       , worked to draw attention to Texas wildflowers.\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Climate">\n        Climate\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_Texas" title="Climate of Texas">\n        Climate of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:TX_koppen.svg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1247" data-file-width="990" height="277" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/TX_koppen.svg/220px-TX_koppen.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/TX_koppen.svg/330px-TX_koppen.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/TX_koppen.svg/440px-TX_koppen.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:TX_koppen.svg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         K\xc3\xb6ppen climate types in Texas\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The large size of Texas and its location at the intersection of multiple\n       <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="K\xc3\xb6ppen climate classification">\n        climate zones\n       </a>\n       gives the state highly variable weather. The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Panhandle" title="Panhandle">\n        Panhandle\n       </a>\n       of the state has colder winters than North Texas, while the Gulf Coast has mild winters. Texas has wide variations in precipitation patterns. El Paso, on the western end of the state, averages 8.7 inches (220\xc2\xa0mm) of annual rainfall,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31">\n        <a href="#cite_note-31">\n         [30]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       while parts of southeast Texas average as much as 64 inches (1,600\xc2\xa0mm) per year.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32">\n        <a href="#cite_note-32">\n         [31]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Dallas in the North Central region averages a more moderate 37 inches (940\xc2\xa0mm) per year.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Snow falls multiple times each winter in the Panhandle and mountainous areas of West Texas, once or twice a year in North Texas, and once every few years in Central and East Texas. Snow falls south of San Antonio or on the coast in rare circumstances only. Of note is the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/2004_Christmas_Eve_snowstorm" title="2004 Christmas Eve snowstorm">\n        2004 Christmas Eve snowstorm\n       </a>\n       , when 6 inches (150\xc2\xa0mm) of snow fell as far south as\n       <a href="/wiki/Kingsville,_Texas" title="Kingsville, Texas">\n        Kingsville\n       </a>\n       , where the average high temperature in December is 65\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0F.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33">\n        <a href="#cite_note-33">\n         [32]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Maximum temperatures in the summer months average from the 80s \xc2\xb0\n       <a href="/wiki/Fahrenheit" title="Fahrenheit">\n        F\n       </a>\n       (26\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C) in the mountains of West Texas and on\n       <a href="/wiki/Galveston_Island" title="Galveston Island">\n        Galveston Island\n       </a>\n       to around 100\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0F (38\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C) in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Rio_Grande_Valley" title="Rio Grande Valley">\n        Rio Grande Valley\n       </a>\n       , but most areas of Texas see consistent summer high temperatures in the 90\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0F (32\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C) range.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Night-time summer temperatures range from the upper 50s \xc2\xb0F (14\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C) in the West Texas mountains\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-weather2_34-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-weather2-34">\n         [33]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       to 80\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0F (27\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C) in Galveston.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-weather3_35-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-weather3-35">\n         [34]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The table below consists of averages for August (generally the warmest month) and January (generally the coldest) in selected cities in various regions of the state. El Paso and Amarillo are exceptions with July and December respectively being the warmest and coldest months respectively, but with August and January only being narrowly different.\n      </p>\n      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="margin:auto;">\n       <caption>\n        Average daily maximum and minimum temperatures for selected cities in Texas\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Texas_climate_averages_36-0">\n         <a href="#cite_note-Texas_climate_averages-36">\n          [35]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </caption>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n         Location\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         August (\xc2\xb0F)\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         August (\xc2\xb0C)\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         January (\xc2\xb0F)\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         January (\xc2\xb0C)\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Houston,_Texas" title="Houston, Texas">\n          Houston\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         94/75\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         34/24\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         63/42\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         17/6\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/San_Antonio,_Texas" title="San Antonio, Texas">\n          San Antonio\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         96/74\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         35/23\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         63/40\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         17/5\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dallas,_Texas" title="Dallas, Texas">\n          Dallas\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         96/77\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         36/25\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         57/37\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         16/3\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Austin,_Texas" title="Austin, Texas">\n          Austin\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         97/74\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         36/23\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         61/45\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         16/5\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/El_Paso,_Texas" title="El Paso, Texas">\n          El Paso\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         92/67\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         33/21\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         57/32\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         14/0\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Laredo,_Texas" title="Laredo, Texas">\n          Laredo\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         100/77\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         37/25\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         67/46\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         19/7\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Amarillo,_Texas" title="Amarillo, Texas">\n          Amarillo\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         89/64\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         32/18\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         50/23\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         10/\xe2\x80\x934\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Brownsville,_Texas" title="Brownsville, Texas">\n          Brownsville\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         94/76\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         34/24\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         70/51\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         21/11\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Storms">\n        Storms\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Thunderstorm" title="Thunderstorm">\n        Thunderstorms\n       </a>\n       strike Texas often, especially the eastern and northern portions of the state.\n       <a href="/wiki/Tornado_Alley" title="Tornado Alley">\n        Tornado Alley\n       </a>\n       covers the northern section of Texas. The state experiences the most\n       <a href="/wiki/Tornado" title="Tornado">\n        tornadoes\n       </a>\n       in the United States, an average of 139 a year. These strike most frequently in North Texas and the Panhandle.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Annual_average_number_of_tornadoes_37-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Annual_average_number_of_tornadoes-37">\n         [36]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Tornadoes in Texas generally occur in the months of April, May, and June.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TexasWeather_38-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TexasWeather-38">\n         [37]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Some of the most destructive hurricanes in U.S. history have impacted Texas. A hurricane in 1875 killed about 400 people in\n       <a href="/wiki/Indianola,_Texas" title="Indianola, Texas">\n        Indianola\n       </a>\n       , followed by\n       <a href="/wiki/1886_Indianola_hurricane" title="1886 Indianola hurricane">\n        another hurricane\n       </a>\n       in 1886 that destroyed the town. These events allowed\n       <a href="/wiki/Galveston,_Texas" title="Galveston, Texas">\n        Galveston\n       </a>\n       to take over as the chief port city. The\n       <a href="/wiki/1900_Galveston_hurricane" title="1900 Galveston hurricane">\n        1900 Galveston hurricane\n       </a>\n       subsequently devastated that city, killing about 8,000 people or possibly as many as 12,000. This makes it the deadliest\n       <a href="/wiki/Natural_disaster" title="Natural disaster">\n        natural disaster\n       </a>\n       in U.S. history.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-deadhurr_39-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-deadhurr-39">\n         [38]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Other devastating Texas hurricanes include the\n       <a href="/wiki/1915_Galveston_hurricane" title="1915 Galveston hurricane">\n        1915 Galveston hurricane\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Audrey" title="Hurricane Audrey">\n        Hurricane Audrey\n       </a>\n       in 1957 which killed over 600 people,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Carla" title="Hurricane Carla">\n        Hurricane Carla\n       </a>\n       in 1961,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Beulah" title="Hurricane Beulah">\n        Hurricane Beulah\n       </a>\n       in 1967,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Alicia" title="Hurricane Alicia">\n        Hurricane Alicia\n       </a>\n       in 1983,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Rita" title="Hurricane Rita">\n        Hurricane Rita\n       </a>\n       in 2005,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Ike" title="Hurricane Ike">\n        Hurricane Ike\n       </a>\n       in 2008, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Hurricane_Harvey" title="Hurricane Harvey">\n        Hurricane Harvey\n       </a>\n       in 2017.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-deadhurr_39-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-deadhurr-39">\n         [38]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_cyclone" title="Tropical cyclone">\n        Tropical storms\n       </a>\n       have also caused their share of damage:\n       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Allison_(1989)" title="Tropical Storm Allison (1989)">\n        Allison\n       </a>\n       in 1989 and again\n       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Allison" title="Tropical Storm Allison">\n        during 2001\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Claudette_(1979)" title="Tropical Storm Claudette (1979)">\n        Claudette\n       </a>\n       in 1979 among them.\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Greenhouse_gases">\n        Greenhouse gases\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       Texas emits the most\n       <a href="/wiki/Greenhouse_gas" title="Greenhouse gas">\n        greenhouse gases\n       </a>\n       in the U.S.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GH1_40-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GH1-40">\n         [39]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GH2_41-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GH2-41">\n         [40]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GH3_42-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GH3-42">\n         [41]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The state emits nearly 1.5 trillion pounds (680 billion kg) of carbon dioxide annually. As an independent nation, Texas would rank as the world\'s seventh-largest producer of greenhouse gases.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GH2_41-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GH2-41">\n         [40]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Causes of the state\'s vast greenhouse gas emissions include the state\'s large number of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fossil_fuel_power_plant" title="Fossil fuel power plant">\n        coal power plants\n       </a>\n       and the state\'s refining and manufacturing industries.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GH2_41-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GH2-41">\n         [40]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2010, there were 2,553 "emission events" which poured 44.6 million pounds of contaminants into the Texas sky.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-43">\n        <a href="#cite_note-43">\n         [42]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="History">\n        History\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/History_of_Texas" title="History of Texas">\n        History of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Pre-European_era">\n        Pre-European era\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <table class="vertical-navbox nowraplinks vcard plainlist" style="float:right;clear:right;width:22.0em;margin:0 0 1.0em 1.0em;background:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;padding:0.2em;border-spacing:0.4em 0;text-align:center;line-height:1.4em;font-size:88%">\n       <tr>\n        <th style="padding:0.2em 0.4em 0.2em;font-size:145%;line-height:1.2em">\n         <div style="margin: -0.2em 0; font-size:65%; font-weight:normal;">\n          Part of\n          <a href="/wiki/Category:History_of_Texas" title="Category:History of Texas">\n           <b>\n            a series\n           </b>\n          </a>\n          on the\n         </div>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th class="vcard navbox-title" style="background: none; font-size: 145%;padding: 0.15em 0.1em;line-height: 1.2em;">\n         <a href="/wiki/History_of_Texas" title="History of Texas">\n          History of\n          <span class="fn org label">\n           Texas\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="padding: 0.2em; border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc;">\n         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Texas_flag_map.svg">\n          <img alt="Texas flag map.svg" data-file-height="1134" data-file-width="1162" height="72" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Texas_flag_map.svg/111px-Texas_flag_map.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Texas_flag_map.svg/148px-Texas_flag_map.svg.png 2x" width="74"/>\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th style="padding:0.1em;background:#eee">\n         Timeline\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="padding:0 0.1em 0.4em">\n         <table style="width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0px 0px;border:none">\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1684\xe2\x80\x931689\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Texas" title="Spanish Texas">\n             Spanish Texas\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1690\xe2\x80\x931821\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/Mexican_Texas" title="Mexican Texas">\n             Mexican Texas\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1821\xe2\x80\x931836\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Texas" title="Republic of Texas">\n             Republic of Texas\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1836\xe2\x80\x931845\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/History_of_Texas_(1845%E2%80%931860)" title="History of Texas (1845\xe2\x80\x931860)">\n             Statehood\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1845\xe2\x80\x931860\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/Texas_in_the_American_Civil_War" title="Texas in the American Civil War">\n             Civil War Era\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1861\xe2\x80\x931865\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n          <tr style="vertical-align:top">\n           <td style="text-align:left;">\n            <a href="/wiki/History_of_Texas_(1865%E2%80%9399)" title="History of Texas (1865\xe2\x80\x9399)">\n             Reconstruction\n            </a>\n           </td>\n           <td style="white-space:nowrap;text-align:right;">\n            1865\xe2\x80\x931899\n           </td>\n          </tr>\n         </table>\n         <a class="mw-selflink selflink">\n          State of Texas\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="padding:0.3em 0.4em 0.3em;font-weight:bold;border-top:#aaa 1px solid; border-bottom:#aaa 1px solid;">\n         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Texas.svg">\n          <img alt="Flag of Texas.svg" class="noviewer" data-file-height="720" data-file-width="1080" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Flag_of_Texas.svg/16px-Flag_of_Texas.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Flag_of_Texas.svg/24px-Flag_of_Texas.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Flag_of_Texas.svg/32px-Flag_of_Texas.svg.png 2x" width="16"/>\n         </a>\n         <a href="/wiki/Portal:Texas" title="Portal:Texas">\n          Texas portal\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:right;font-size:115%">\n         <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini">\n          <ul>\n           <li class="nv-view">\n            <a href="/wiki/Template:History_of_Texas" title="Template:History of Texas">\n             <abbr title="View this template">\n              v\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="nv-talk">\n            <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:History_of_Texas" title="Template talk:History of Texas">\n             <abbr title="Discuss this template">\n              t\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="nv-edit">\n            <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:History_of_Texas&amp;action=edit">\n             <abbr title="Edit this template">\n              e\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/Pre-Columbian_Mexico" title="Pre-Columbian Mexico">\n        Pre-Columbian Mexico\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Texas lies between two major cultural spheres of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pre-Columbian_North_America" title="Pre-Columbian North America">\n        Pre-Columbian North America\n       </a>\n       : the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Southwestern_tribes" title="Southwestern tribes">\n        Southwestern\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Plains_Indians" title="Plains Indians">\n        Plains\n       </a>\n       areas.\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Archaeologists" title="Archaeologists">\n        Archaeologists\n       </a>\n       have found that three major indigenous cultures lived in this territory, and reached their developmental peak before the first European contact. These were:\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Richardson_44-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Richardson-44">\n         [43]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        the\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ancient_Pueblo_Peoples" title="Ancient Pueblo Peoples">\n         Pueblo\n        </a>\n        from the upper\n        <a href="/wiki/Rio_Grande" title="Rio Grande">\n         Rio Grande\n        </a>\n        region, centered west of Texas;\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        the\n        <a href="/wiki/Mississippian_culture" title="Mississippian culture">\n         Mississippian culture\n        </a>\n        , also known as\n        <a href="/wiki/Mound_Builders" title="Mound Builders">\n         Mound Builders\n        </a>\n        , which extended along the\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mississippi_River_Valley" title="Mississippi River Valley">\n         Mississippi River Valley\n        </a>\n        east of Texas; and\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        the civilizations of\n        <a href="/wiki/Mesoamerica" title="Mesoamerica">\n         Mesoamerica\n        </a>\n        , centered south of Texas. Influence of\n        <a href="/wiki/Teotihuacan" title="Teotihuacan">\n         Teotihuacan\n        </a>\n        in northern Mexico peaked around AD 500 and declined over the 8th to 10th centuries.\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <p>\n       No culture was dominant in the present-day Texas region, and many peoples inhabited the area.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Richardson_44-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Richardson-44">\n         [43]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Native American tribes that lived inside the boundaries of present-day Texas include the\n       <a href="/wiki/Alabama_people" title="Alabama people">\n        Alabama\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Apache" title="Apache">\n        Apache\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Atakapa" title="Atakapa">\n        Atakapan\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Bidai" title="Bidai">\n        Bidai\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Caddo" title="Caddo">\n        Caddo\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Coahuiltecan_people" title="Coahuiltecan people">\n        Coahuiltecan\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Comanche" title="Comanche">\n        Comanche\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Choctaw" title="Choctaw">\n        Choctaw\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Coushatta" title="Coushatta">\n        Coushatta\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Hasinai" title="Hasinai">\n        Hasinai\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Jumano_people" title="Jumano people">\n        Jumano\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Karankawa_people" title="Karankawa people">\n        Karankawa\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Kickapoo_people" title="Kickapoo people">\n        Kickapoo\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Kiowa" title="Kiowa">\n        Kiowa\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Tonkawa" title="Tonkawa">\n        Tonkawa\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Wichita_people" title="Wichita people">\n        Wichita\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-45">\n        <a href="#cite_note-45">\n         [44]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nativeamericans_46-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nativeamericans-46">\n         [45]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The name\n       <i>\n        <b>\n         Texas\n        </b>\n       </i>\n       derives from\n       <i>\n        t\xc3\xa1ysha\xca\x94\n       </i>\n       , a word in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Caddoan_languages" title="Caddoan languages">\n        Caddoan language\n       </a>\n       of the\n       <i>\n        Hasinai\n       </i>\n       , which means "friends" or "allies".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-facts_2-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-facts-2">\n         [2]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TribesofTexas_17-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TribesofTexas-17">\n         [16]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup
