text-align: center;">\n         94.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1890_United_States_Census" title="1890 United States Census">\n           1890\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         2,235,527\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         40.4%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1900_United_States_Census" title="1900 United States Census">\n           1900\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         3,048,710\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         36.4%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1910_United_States_Census" title="1910 United States Census">\n           1910\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         3,896,542\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         27.8%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1920_United_States_Census" title="1920 United States Census">\n           1920\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         4,663,228\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         19.7%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1930_United_States_Census" title="1930 United States Census">\n           1930\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         5,824,715\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         24.9%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1940_United_States_Census" title="1940 United States Census">\n           1940\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         6,414,824\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         10.1%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1950_United_States_Census" title="1950 United States Census">\n           1950\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         7,711,194\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         20.2%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1960_United_States_Census" title="1960 United States Census">\n           1960\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         9,579,677\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         24.2%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1970_United_States_Census" title="1970 United States Census">\n           1970\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         11,196,730\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         16.9%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1980_United_States_Census" title="1980 United States Census">\n           1980\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         14,229,191\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         27.1%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1990_United_States_Census" title="1990 United States Census">\n           1990\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         16,986,510\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         19.4%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/2000_United_States_Census" title="2000 United States Census">\n           2000\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         20,851,820\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         22.8%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_Census" title="2010 United States Census">\n           2010\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         25,145,561\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         20.6%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          Est. 2016\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         27,862,596\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         10.8%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td colspan="4" style="border-top:1px solid black; font-size:85%; text-align:center">\n         1910 \xe2\x80\x93 2010 census\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census2010_196-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-census2010-196">\n           [194]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         <br/>\n         2016 Estimate\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstUS_197-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-PopEstUS-197">\n           [195]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:352px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Texas_population_map2.png">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="475" data-file-width="624" height="266" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cb/Texas_population_map2.png/350px-Texas_population_map2.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cb/Texas_population_map2.png/525px-Texas_population_map2.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/cb/Texas_population_map2.png 2x" width="350"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Texas_population_map2.png" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         Texas population density map\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">\n        United States Census Bureau\n       </a>\n       estimates that the population of Texas was 27,469,114 on July 1, 2015, a 9.24 percent increase since the\n       <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_Census" title="2010 United States Census">\n        2010 United States Census\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstUS_197-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PopEstUS-197">\n         [195]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       As of 2004, the state had 3.5 million foreign-born residents (15.6 percent of the state population), of which an estimated 1.2 million are\n       <a href="/wiki/Illegal_immigration_to_the_United_States" title="Illegal immigration to the United States">\n        illegal\n       </a>\n       . Texas from 2000 to 2006 had the fastest growing illegal immigration rate in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CausesHealthcare_198-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CausesHealthcare-198">\n         [196]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2010, illegal immigrants constituted an estimated 6.0 percent of the population. This was the fifth highest percentage of any state in the country.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-199">\n        <a href="#cite_note-199">\n         [197]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-200">\n        <a href="#cite_note-200">\n         [198]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2015, the population of illegal immigrants living in Texas was around 800,000.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-201">\n        <a href="#cite_note-201">\n         [199]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas\'\n       <a href="/wiki/Rio_Grande_Valley" title="Rio Grande Valley">\n        Rio Grande Valley\n       </a>\n       has seen significant migration from across the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/U.S.-Mexico_border" title="U.S.-Mexico border">\n        U.S.-Mexico border\n       </a>\n       . During the\n       <a href="/wiki/2014_American_immigration_crisis" title="2014 American immigration crisis">\n        2014 crisis\n       </a>\n       , many\n       <a href="/wiki/Central_America" title="Central America">\n        Central Americans\n       </a>\n       , including unaccompanied minors traveling alone from\n       <a href="/wiki/Guatemala" title="Guatemala">\n        Guatemala\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Honduras" title="Honduras">\n        Honduras\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/El_Salvador" title="El Salvador">\n        El Salvador\n       </a>\n       , reached the state, overwhelming Border Patrol resources for a time. Many sought\n       <a href="/wiki/Right_of_asylum" title="Right of asylum">\n        asylum\n       </a>\n       in the United States.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-latimes-immigration_202-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-latimes-immigration-202">\n         [200]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-203">\n        <a href="#cite_note-203">\n         [201]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In 2009, the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/U.S._Department_of_Homeland_Security" title="U.S. Department of Homeland Security">\n        U.S. Department of Homeland Security\n       </a>\n       estimated that 1.68 million illegal immigrants lived in Texas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-204">\n        <a href="#cite_note-204">\n         [202]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       While the number of illegals living in the U.S. has declined since 2009, in Texas there was no change in population between 2009 and 2014.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-205">\n        <a href="#cite_note-205">\n         [203]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas\'s population density is 90.5\xc2\xa0people per square\xc2\xa0mile which is slightly higher than the average\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_population_density" title="List of countries by population density">\n        population density\n       </a>\n       of the U.S. as a whole, at 80.6\xc2\xa0people per square\xc2\xa0mile. In contrast, while Texas and France are similarly sized geographically, the European country has a population density of 301.8 people per square mile.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Two-thirds of all Texans live in a major metropolitan area such as Houston. The Dallas-Fort Worth Metropolitan Area is the largest in Texas. While Houston is the largest city in Texas and the fourth largest city in the United States, the Dallas-Fort Worth metropolitan area is larger than that of Houston.\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ethnicity">\n        Ethnicity\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       As of the 2015 Texas Population Estimate Program, the population of the state was 27,469,114\n       <a href="/wiki/Non-Hispanic_whites" title="Non-Hispanic whites">\n        non-Hispanic whites\n       </a>\n       11,505,371 (41.9%);\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Black_American" title="Black American">\n        Black Americans\n       </a>\n       3,171,043 (11.5%); other races 1,793,580 (6.5%); and\n       <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">\n        Hispanics and Latinos\n       </a>\n       (of any race) 10,999,120 (40.0%).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Texas_Demographic_Center_206-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Texas_Demographic_Center-206">\n         [204]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       According to the 2010\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/United_States_census" title="United States census">\n        United States census\n       </a>\n       , the racial composition of Texas was the following:\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-207">\n        <a href="#cite_note-207">\n         [205]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/White_American" title="White American">\n         White American\n        </a>\n        70.4 percent (\n        <a href="/wiki/Non-Hispanic_whites" title="Non-Hispanic whites">\n         Non-Hispanic whites\n        </a>\n        45.3 percent)\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Black_American" title="Black American">\n         Black or African American\n        </a>\n        : 11.8 percent\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n         American Indian\n        </a>\n        : 0.7 percent\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Asian_American" title="Asian American">\n         Asian\n        </a>\n        : 3.8 percent\n        <small>\n         (1.0 percent\n         <a href="/wiki/Indian_people" title="Indian people">\n          Indian\n         </a>\n         , 0.8 percent\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vietnamese_American" title="Vietnamese American">\n          Vietnamese\n         </a>\n         , 0.6 percent\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_American" title="Chinese American">\n          Chinese\n         </a>\n         , 0.4 percent\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Filipino_American" title="Filipino American">\n          Filipino\n         </a>\n         , 0.3 percent\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Korean_American" title="Korean American">\n          Korean\n         </a>\n         , 0.1 percent\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Japanese_American" title="Japanese American">\n          Japanese\n         </a>\n         , 0.6 percent other Asian)\n        </small>\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pacific_Islander_American" title="Pacific Islander American">\n         Pacific Islander\n        </a>\n        : 0.1 percent\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        Some other race: 10.5 percent\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Multiracial_American" title="Multiracial American">\n         Two or more races\n        </a>\n        : 2.7 percent\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <p>\n       In addition, 37.6 percent of the population are\n       <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">\n        Hispanic or Latino\n       </a>\n       (of any race)\n       <small>\n        (31.6 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mexican_American" title="Mexican American">\n         Mexican\n        </a>\n        , 0.9 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Salvadoran_American" title="Salvadoran American">\n         Salvadoran\n        </a>\n        , 0.5 percent\n        <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Ricans_in_the_United_States" title="Puerto Ricans in the United States">\n         Puerto Rican\n        </a>\n        , 0.4 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Honduran_American" title="Honduran American">\n         Honduran\n        </a>\n        , 0.3 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Guatemalan_American" title="Guatemalan American">\n         Guatemalan\n        </a>\n        0.3 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Spanish_American" title="Spanish American">\n         Spaniard\n        </a>\n        , 0.2 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colombian_American" title="Colombian American">\n         Colombian\n        </a>\n        , 0.2 percent\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cuban_American" title="Cuban American">\n         Cuban\n        </a>\n        )\n       </small>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-208">\n        <a href="#cite_note-208">\n         [206]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       As of 2011, 69.8% of the population of Texas younger than age 1 were minorities (meaning that they had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-209">\n        <a href="#cite_note-209">\n         [207]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <table class="wikitable sortable collapsible" style="font-size: 90%;">\n       <caption>\n        <b>\n         Texas racial breakdown of population\n        </b>\n       </caption>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n         Racial composition\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         1970\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census_210-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-census-210">\n           [208]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         1990\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census_210-1">\n          <a href="#cite_note-census-210">\n           [208]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         2000\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-211">\n          <a href="#cite_note-211">\n           [209]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         2010\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-212">\n          <a href="#cite_note-212">\n           [210]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/White_American" title="White American">\n          White\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         86.8%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         75.2%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         71.0%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         70.4%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/African_American" title="African American">\n          Black\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         12.5%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         11.9%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         11.5%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         11.9%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Asian_American" title="Asian American">\n          Asian\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.2%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1.9%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         2.7%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         3.8%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n          Native\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.2%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.4%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.6%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.7%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Native_Hawaiian" title="Native Hawaiian">\n          Native Hawaiian\n         </a>\n         and\n         <br/>\n         <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Islander" title="Pacific Islander">\n          other Pacific Islander\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         \xe2\x80\x93\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         \xe2\x80\x93\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.1%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.1%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Race_and_ethnicity_in_the_United_States_Census" title="Race and ethnicity in the United States Census">\n          Other race\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.4%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         10.6%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         11.7%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         10.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Multiracial_American" title="Multiracial American">\n          Two or more races\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         \xe2\x80\x93\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         \xe2\x80\x93\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         2.5%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         2.7%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="362" data-file-width="609" height="131" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg/220px-Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg/330px-Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg/440px-Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Comanche_Osage_fight.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         War on the plains.\n         <a href="/wiki/Comanche" title="Comanche">\n          Comanche\n         </a>\n         (right) trying to lance Osage warrior. Painting by\n         <a href="/wiki/George_Catlin" title="George Catlin">\n          George Catlin\n         </a>\n         , 1834\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/German_American" title="German American">\n        German\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Irish_American" title="Irish American">\n        Irish\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">\n        English Americans\n       </a>\n       are the three largest European ancestry groups in Texas. German Americans make up 11.3 percent of the population, and number over 2.7 million members. Irish Americans make up 8.2 percent of the population, and number over 1.9 million members. There are roughly 600,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/French_American" title="French American">\n        French Americans\n       </a>\n       and 472,000 Italian Americans residing in Texas; these two ethnic groups make up 2.5 percent and 2.0 percent of the population respectively. In the\n       <a href="/wiki/1980_United_States_Census" title="1980 United States Census">\n        1980 United States Census\n       </a>\n       the largest ancestry group reported in Texas was\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">\n        English\n       </a>\n       with 3,083,323 Texans citing that they were of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">\n        English\n       </a>\n       or mostly\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">\n        English\n       </a>\n       ancestry making them 27 percent of the state at the time.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-213">\n        <a href="#cite_note-213">\n         [211]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Their ancestry primarily goes back to the original thirteen colonies and thus many of them today identify as "American" in ancestry, though they are of predominately\n       <a href="/wiki/British_Isles" title="British Isles">\n        British\n       </a>\n       stock.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-214">\n        <a href="#cite_note-214">\n         [212]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-215">\n        <a href="#cite_note-215">\n         [213]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       There are nearly 200,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Czech_Texan" title="Czech Texan">\n        Czech-Americans\n       </a>\n       living in Texas, the largest number of any state.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-216">\n        <a href="#cite_note-216">\n         [214]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       African Americans are the largest racial minority in Texas. Their proportion of population has declined since the early 20th century, after many left the state in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Migration_(African_American)" title="Great Migration (African American)">\n        Great Migration\n       </a>\n       . Blacks of both Hispanic and non-Hispanic origin make up 11.5 percent of the population; blacks of non-Hispanic origin form 11.3 percent of the populace. African Americans of both Hispanic and non-Hispanic origin number at roughly 2.7 million individuals.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Native Americans are a smaller minority in the state. Native Americans make up 0.5 percent of Texas\' population, and number over 118,000 individuals. Native Americans of non-Hispanic origin make up 0.3 percent of the population, and number over 75,000 individuals.\n       <a href="/wiki/Cherokee" title="Cherokee">\n        Cherokee\n       </a>\n       made up 0.1 percent of the population, and numbered over 19,400 members. In contrast, only 583 identified as\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chippewa" title="Chippewa">\n        Chippewa\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Emory-El_Paso.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="535" data-file-width="700" height="168" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Emory-El_Paso.jpg/220px-Emory-El_Paso.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Emory-El_Paso.jpg/330px-Emory-El_Paso.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Emory-El_Paso.jpg/440px-Emory-El_Paso.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Emory-El_Paso.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/El_Paso,_Texas" title="El Paso, Texas">\n          El Paso\n         </a>\n         , founded by Spanish settlers in 1659\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Asian Americans are a sizable minority group in Texas. Americans of Asian descent form 3.8 percent of the population, with those of non-Hispanic descent making up 3.7 percent of the populace. They total more than 808,000 individuals. Non-Hispanic Asians number over 795,000. Just over 200,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indian_American" title="Indian American">\n        Indian Americans\n       </a>\n       make Texas their home. Texas is also home to over 187,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vietnamese_American" title="Vietnamese American">\n        Vietnamese\n       </a>\n       and 136,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_American" title="Chinese American">\n        Chinese\n       </a>\n       . In addition to 92,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Filipino_American" title="Filipino American">\n        Filipinos\n       </a>\n       and 62,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Korean_American" title="Korean American">\n        Koreans\n       </a>\n       , there are 18,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Japanese_American" title="Japanese American">\n        Japanese Americans\n       </a>\n       living in the state. Lastly, over 111,000 people are of other Asian ancestry groups, such as\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cambodian_American" title="Cambodian American">\n        Cambodian\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Thai_American" title="Thai American">\n        Thai\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hmong_American" title="Hmong American">\n        Hmong\n       </a>\n       .\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sugar_Land,_TX" title="Sugar Land, TX">\n        Sugar Land\n       </a>\n       , a city within the Houston metropolitan area, and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Plano,_TX" title="Plano, TX">\n        Plano\n       </a>\n       , located within the Dallas metropolitan area, both have high concentrations of ethnic Chinese and Korean residents. The Houston and Dallas areas, and to a lesser extent, the Austin metropolitan area, all contain substantial Vietnamese communities.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Americans with origins from the Pacific are the smallest minority in Texas. According to the survey, only 18,000 Texans are Pacific Islanders; 16,400 are of non-Hispanic descent. There are roughly 5,400\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_Hawaiians" title="Native Hawaiians">\n        Native Hawaiians\n       </a>\n       , 5,300 Guamanians, and 6,400 people from other groups.\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Samoan_American" title="Samoan American">\n        Samoan Americans\n       </a>\n       were scant; only 2,920 people were from this group. The city of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Euless" title="Euless">\n        Euless\n       </a>\n       , a suburb of\n       <a href="/wiki/Fort_Worth,_Texas" title="Fort Worth, Texas">\n        Fort Worth\n       </a>\n       , contains a sizable population of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tongan_American" title="Tongan American">\n        Tongan Americans\n       </a>\n       , at nearly 900 people, over one percent of the city\'s population.\n       <a href="/wiki/Killeen,_Texas" title="Killeen, Texas">\n        Killeen\n       </a>\n       has a sufficient population of Samoans and Guamanian, and people of Pacific Islander descent surpass one percent of the city\'s population.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Multiracial individuals are also a visible minority in Texas. People identifying as multiracial form 1.9 percent of the population, and number over 448,000 people. Almost 80,000 Texans claim African and European heritage, and make up 0.3 percent of the population. People of European and Native American heritage number over 108,800 (close to the number of Native Americans), and make up 0.5 percent of the population. People of European and Asian heritage number over 57,600, and form just 0.2 percent of the population. People of African and Native American heritage were even smaller in number (15,300), and make up just 0.1 percent of the total population.\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007,_Zeichnung,_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="448" data-file-width="800" height="123" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg/220px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg/330px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg/440px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007%2C_Zeichnung%2C_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_137-005007,_Zeichnung,_Deutscher_Einwandererzug_in_Texas.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         German trek on its way to\n         <a href="/wiki/New_Braunfels,_Texas" title="New Braunfels, Texas">\n          New Braunfels\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Hispanics and Latinos are the second largest group in Texas after non-Hispanic\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_American" title="European American">\n        European Americans\n       </a>\n       . Over 8.5 million people claim Hispanic or Latino ethnicity. This group forms over 37 percent of Texas\' population. People of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mexican_American" title="Mexican American">\n        Mexican\n       </a>\n       descent alone number over 7.9 million, and make up 31.6 percent of the population. The vast majority of the Hispanic/Latino population in the state is of Mexican descent, the next two largest groups are Salvadorans and Puerto Ricans. There are over 222,000\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Salvadoran_American" title="Salvadoran American">\n        Salvadorans\n       </a>\n       and over 130,000\n       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Ricans_in_the_United_States" title="Puerto Ricans in the United States">\n        Puerto Ricans\n       </a>\n       in Texas. Other groups with large numbers in Texas include\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Honduran_American" title="Honduran American">\n        Hondurans\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Guatemalan_American" title="Guatemalan American">\n        Guatemalans\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nicaraguan_American" title="Nicaraguan American">\n        Nicaraguans\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cuban_American" title="Cuban American">\n        Cubans\n       </a>\n       , among others.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-217">\n        <a href="#cite_note-217">\n         [215]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-218">\n        <a href="#cite_note-218">\n         [216]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The Hispanics in Texas are more likely than in some other states (such as California) to identify as white; according to the 2010 U.S. Census, Texas is home to 6,304,207\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/White_Hispanics" title="White Hispanics">\n        White Hispanics\n       </a>\n       and 2,594,206 Hispanics of "some other race" (usually\n       <a href="/wiki/Mestizo" title="Mestizo">\n        mestizo\n       </a>\n       ).\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Praha_texas.jpeg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="400" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Praha_texas.jpeg/220px-Praha_texas.jpeg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Praha_texas.jpeg/330px-Praha_texas.jpeg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/be/Praha_texas.jpeg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Praha_texas.jpeg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         Welcome to\n         <a href="/wiki/Praha,_Texas" title="Praha, Texas">\n          Praha, Texas\n         </a>\n         , "Czech Capital of Texas".\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       German descendants inhabit much of central and southeast-central Texas. Over one-third of Texas residents are of Hispanic origin; while many have recently arrived, some\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tejanos" title="Tejanos">\n        Tejanos\n       </a>\n       have ancestors with multi-generational ties to 18th century Texas. In addition to the descendants of the state\'s former slave population, many African American college graduates have come to the state for work recently in the\n       <a href="/wiki/New_Great_Migration" title="New Great Migration">\n        New Great Migration\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-blackmigration_219-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-blackmigration-219">\n         [217]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Recently, the Asian population in Texas has grown\xe2\x80\x94primarily in Houston and Dallas. Other communities with a significantly growing Asian American population is in Austin, Corpus Christi, and the Sharyland area next\n       <a href="/wiki/McAllen,_Texas" title="McAllen, Texas">\n        McAllen, Texas\n       </a>\n       . Three federally recognized Native American tribes reside in Texas: the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Alabama-Coushatta" title="Alabama-Coushatta">\n        Alabama-Coushatta\n       </a>\n       Tribe, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Kickapoo_people" title="Kickapoo people">\n        Kickapoo\n       </a>\n       Traditional Tribe, and the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ysleta_Del_Sur_Pueblo" title="Ysleta Del Sur Pueblo">\n        Ysleta Del Sur Pueblo\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nativeamericans_46-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nativeamericans-46">\n         [45]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In 2010, 49 percent of all births were Hispanics; 35 percent were non-Hispanic whites; 11.5 percent were non-Hispanic blacks, and 4.3 percent were Asians/Pacific Islanders.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-220">\n        <a href="#cite_note-220">\n         [218]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Based on Census Bureau data released on February 2011, for the first time in recent history, Texas\' white population is below 50 percent (45 percent) and Hispanics grew to 38 percent. Between 2000 and 2010, the total population growth by 20.6 percent, but Hispanics growth by 65 percent, whereas non-Hispanic whites only grew by 4.2 percent.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-221">\n        <a href="#cite_note-221">\n         [219]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas has the fifth highest rate of teenage births in the nation and a plurality of these are to Hispanics.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-222">\n        <a href="#cite_note-222">\n         [220]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Cities_and_towns">\n        Cities and towns\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Texas" title="List of cities in Texas">\n        List of cities in Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_counties_in_Texas" title="List of counties in Texas">\n        List of counties in Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Texas_metropolitan_areas" title="List of Texas metropolitan areas">\n        List of Texas metropolitan areas\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Texas_by_population" title="List of cities in Texas by population">\n        List of cities in Texas by population\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <table class="wikitable floatleft" style="text-align:center;">\n       <tr>\n        <th colspan="2">\n         <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Texas_by_population" title="List of cities in Texas by population">\n          Largest city in Texas\n         </a>\n         by year\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Census_Largest_Cities_223-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Census_Largest_Cities-223">\n           [221]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n         Year(s)\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         City\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         1850\xe2\x80\x931870\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio" title="San Antonio">\n          San Antonio\n         </a>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SATX_TSHA_224-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-SATX_TSHA-224">\n           [222]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         1870\xe2\x80\x931890\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Galveston,_Texas" title="Galveston, Texas">\n          Galveston\n         </a>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GTX_TSHA_225-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-GTX_TSHA-225">\n           [223]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         1890\xe2\x80\x931900\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Dallas" title="Dallas">\n          Dallas\n         </a>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Census_Largest_Cities_223-1">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Census_Largest_Cities-223">\n           [221]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         1900\xe2\x80\x931930\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio" title="San Antonio">\n          San Antonio\n         </a>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SATX_TSHA_224-1">\n          <a href="#cite_note-SATX_TSHA-224">\n           [222]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         1930\xe2\x80\x93present\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">\n          Houston\n         </a>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HTX_TSHA_226-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-HTX_TSHA-226">\n           [224]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       The state has three cities with populations exceeding one million: Houston, San Antonio, and Dallas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstBigCities_227-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PopEstBigCities-227">\n         [225]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       These three rank among the 10 most populous cities of the United States. As of 2010, six Texas cities had populations greater than 600,000 people. Austin, Fort Worth, and El Paso are among the 20\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">\n        largest U.S. cities\n       </a>\n       . Texas has four\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Texas_metropolitan_areas" title="List of Texas metropolitan areas">\n        metropolitan areas\n       </a>\n       with populations greater than a million:\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dallas-Fort_Worth_Metroplex" title="Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex">\n         Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth\xe2\x80\x93Arlington\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Greater_Houston" title="Greater Houston">\n         Houston\xe2\x80\x93Sugar Land\xe2\x80\x93Baytown\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Greater_San_Antonio" title="Greater San Antonio">\n         San Antonio\xe2\x80\x93New Braunfels\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       , and\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Greater_Austin" title="Greater Austin">\n         Austin\xe2\x80\x93Round Rock\xe2\x80\x93San Marcos\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       . The Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth and Houston metropolitan areas number about 6.3 million and 5.7 million residents, respectively.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Three\n       <a href="/wiki/Interstate_Highway_System" title="Interstate Highway System">\n        interstate highways\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Interstate_35_(Texas)" title="Interstate 35 (Texas)">\n        I-35\n       </a>\n       to the west (Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth to San Antonio, with Austin in between),\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Interstate_45_(Texas)" title="Interstate 45 (Texas)">\n        I-45\n       </a>\n       to the east (Dallas to Houston), and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Interstate_10_(Texas)" title="Interstate 10 (Texas)">\n        I-10\n       </a>\n       to the south (San Antonio to Houston) define the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Texas_Urban_Triangle" title="Texas Urban Triangle">\n        Texas Urban Triangle\n       </a>\n       region. The region of 60,000 square miles (160,000\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ) contains most of the state\'s largest cities and metropolitan areas as well as 17 million people, nearly 75 percent of Texas\'s total population.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urbantriangle_228-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-urbantriangle-228">\n         [226]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Houston and Dallas have been recognized as beta\n       <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">\n        world cities\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-worldcities_229-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-worldcities-229">\n         [227]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       These cities are spread out amongst the state. Texas has\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_counties_in_Texas" title="List of counties in Texas">\n        254 counties\n       </a>\n       , which is more than any other state by 95 (Georgia).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-230">\n        <a href="#cite_note-230">\n         [228]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In contrast to the cities, unincorporated rural settlements known as\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colonia_(border_settlement)" title="Colonia (border settlement)">\n        colonias\n       </a>\n       often lack basic infrastructure and are marked by poverty.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colonias_231-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Colonias-231">\n         [229]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The office of the Texas Attorney General stated, in 2011, that Texas had about 2,294 colonias and estimates that about 500,000 lived in the colonias.\n       <a href="/wiki/Hidalgo_County,_Texas" title="Hidalgo County, Texas">\n        Hidalgo County\n       </a>\n       , as of 2011, has the largest number of colonias.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Grinberg_232-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Grinberg-232">\n         [230]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas has the largest number of people of all states, living in colonias.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Colonias_231-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Colonias-231">\n         [229]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <table class="navbox">\n       <tr>\n        <th class="navbox-title" colspan="10">\n         <div style="float:right; width:6em; height:2.6em">\n         </div>\n         <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="float: left;height:2.6em;">\n          <ul>\n           <li class="nv-view">\n            <a href="/wiki/Template:Largest_cities" title="Template:Largest cities">\n             <abbr title="View this template">\n              v\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="nv-talk">\n            <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Largest_cities" title="Template talk:Largest cities">\n             <abbr title="Discuss this template">\n              t\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="nv-edit">\n            <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Largest_cities&amp;action=edit">\n             <abbr title="Edit this template">\n              e\n             </abbr>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </div>\n         <div style="height:2.6em;line-height:1.3em;">\n          <span style="font-size:110%;">\n           Largest cities or towns in Texas\n          </span>\n          <br/>\n          <span style="font-weight:normal;">\n           Source:\n           <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-233">\n            <a href="#cite_note-233">\n             [231]\n            </a>\n           </sup>\n          </span>\n         </div>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n        </th>\n population">\n          Pop.\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <th>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td rowspan="11" style="text-align: center">\n         <a class="image"        <img alt="San Antonio" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="166" data-file-width="700" height="28"       </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Harris_County,_Texas" title="Harris County, Texas">\n          Harris\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n         2,195,914\n        </td>\n        <td rowspan="11" style="text-align: center">\n         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Downtown_Dallas_from_the_Trinity_River.jpg" title="Dallas">\n          <img alt="Dallas" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="577" data-file-width="1024" height="68"   <a href="/wiki/Dallas" title="Dallas">\n          Dallas\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:AustinSkylineLouNeffPoint-2010-03-29-b.JPG" title="Austin">\n          <img alt="Austin" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1316" data-file-width="2538" height="62" //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/AustinSkylineLouNeffPoint-2010-03-29-b.JPG/240px-AustinSkylineLouNeffPoint-2010-03-29-b.JPG 2x" width="120"/>\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Austin" title="Austin">\n          Austin\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">\n         2\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio" title="San Antonio">\n          San Antonio\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Bexar_County,_Texas" title="Bexar County, Texas">\n          Bexar\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n         1,409,019\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">\n         3\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a Texas">\n          Dallas\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n         1,257,676\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td Austin\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Travis_County,_Texas" title="Travis County, Texas">\n          Travis\n         </a>\n  <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fort_Worth" title="Fort Worth">\n          Fort Worth\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Tarrant_County,_Texas" title="Tarrant County, Texas">\n          Tarrant\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n         792,727\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">\n         6\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect"  <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Corpus_Christi,_Texas" title="Corpus Christi, Texas">\n          Corpus Christi\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Nueces_County,_Texas" title="Nueces County, Texas">\n          Nueces\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n     </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:left;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Webb_County,_Texas" title="Webb County, Texas">\n          Webb\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td style="text-align:right;">\n         248,142\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Languages">\n        Languages\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       The most common\n       <a href="/wiki/Accent_(sociolinguistics)" title="Accent (sociolinguistics)">\n        accent\n       </a>\n       and/or\n       <a href="/wiki/Dialect" title="Dialect">\n        dialect\n       </a>\n       spoken by natives throughout Texas is sometimes referred to as\n       <a href="/wiki/Texan_English" title="Texan English">\n        Texan English\n       </a>\n       , which itself is a sub-variety of a broader category of\n       <a href="/wiki/American_English" title="American English">\n        American English\n       </a>\n       known as\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_American_English" title="Southern American English">\n        Southern American English\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-234">\n        <a href="#cite_note-234">\n         [232]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-235">\n        <a href="#cite_note-235">\n         [233]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Creole_language" title="Creole language">\n        Creole language\n       </a>\n       is spoken in East Texas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-236">\n        <a href="#cite_note-236">\n         [234]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In some areas of the state\xe2\x80\x94particularly in the large cities \xe2\x80\x93\n       <a href="/wiki/Western_American_English" title="Western American English">\n        Western American English\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/General_American_English" title="General American English">\n        General American English\n       </a>\n       , have been on the increase.\n       <a href="/wiki/Chicano_English" title="Chicano English">\n        Chicano English\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94due to a growing Hispanic population\xe2\x80\x94is widespread in South Texas, while\n       <a href="/wiki/African_American_Vernacular_English" title="African American Vernacular English">\n        African American Vernacular English\n       </a>\n       , is especially notable in historically minority areas of urban Texas.\n      </p>\n      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="margin-left:1em; float:center">\n       <caption>\n        <b>\n         Top 10 Non-English Languages Spoken in Texas\n        </b>\n       </caption>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n         Language\n        </th>\n        <th>\n         Percentage of population\n         <br/>\n         <small>\n          (as of 2010)\n         </small>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MLA_Data_237-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-MLA_Data-237">\n           [235]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Spanish_language" title="Spanish language">\n          Spanish\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         29.21%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Vietnamese_language" title="Vietnamese language">\n          Vietnamese\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.75%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Chinese_language" title="Chinese language">\n          Chinese\n         </a>\n         (including\n         <a href="/wiki/Standard_Chinese" title="Standard Chinese">\n          Mandarin\n         </a>\n         and\n         <a href="/wiki/Cantonese" title="Cantonese">\n          Cantonese\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.56%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/German_language" title="German language">\n          German\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.33%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Tagalog_language" title="Tagalog language">\n          Tagalog\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.29%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">\n          French\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.25%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Korean_language" title="Korean language">\n          Korean\n         </a>\n         and\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Urdu_language" title="Urdu language">\n          Urdu\n         </a>\n         (tied)\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.24%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hindi_language" title="Hindi language">\n          Hindi\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.23%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arabic_language" title="Arabic language">\n          Arabic\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.21%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Niger-Congo_languages" title="Niger-Congo languages">\n          Niger-Congo languages\n         </a>\n         of\n         <a href="/wiki/West_Africa" title="West Africa">\n          West Africa\n         </a>\n         (\n         <a href="/wiki/Igbo_language" title="Igbo language">\n          Ibo\n         </a>\n         ,\n         <a href="/wiki/Kru_languages" title="Kru languages">\n          Kru\n         </a>\n         , and\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Yoruba_languages" title="Yoruba languages">\n          Yoruba\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.15%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       As of 2010, 65.8% (14,740,304) of Texas residents age 5 and older spoke only\n       <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">\n        English\n       </a>\n       at home, while 29.2% (6,543,702) spoke\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_language" title="Spanish language">\n        Spanish\n       </a>\n       , 0.75 percent (168,886)\n       <a href="/wiki/Vietnamese_language" title="Vietnamese language">\n        Vietnamese\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Chinese_language" title="Chinese language">\n        Chinese\n       </a>\n       (which includes\n       <a href="/wiki/Cantonese" title="Cantonese">\n        Cantonese\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Standard_Chinese" title="Standard Chinese">\n        Mandarin\n       </a>\n       ) was spoken by 0.56% (122,921) of the population over the age of five.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MLA_Data_237-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MLA_Data-237">\n         [235]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Other languages spoken include\n       <a href="/wiki/German_language" title="German language">\n        German\n       </a>\n       (including\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_German" title="Texas German">\n        Texas German\n       </a>\n       ) by 0.33% (73,137,)\n       <a href="/wiki/Tagalog_language" title="Tagalog language">\n        Tagalog\n       </a>\n       with 0.29% (73,137) speakers, and\n       <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">\n        French\n       </a>\n       (including\n       <a href="/wiki/Cajun_French" title="Cajun French">\n        Cajun French\n       </a>\n       ) was spoken by 0.25% (55,773) of Texans.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MLA_Data_237-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MLA_Data-237">\n         [235]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Reportedly,\n       <a href="/wiki/Cherokee_language" title="Cherokee language">\n        Cherokee\n       </a>\n       is the most widely spoken\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Native_American_language" title="Native American language">\n        Native American language\n       </a>\n       in Texas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-238">\n        <a href="#cite_note-238">\n         [236]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In total, 34.2% (7,660,406) of Texas\'s population aged five and older spoke a language at home other than English.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MLA_Data_237-3">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MLA_Data-237">\n         [235]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">\n        Religion\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       The 2014 Pew Religious Landscape Survey showed the religious makeup of the state was as follows:\n      </p>\n      <center>\n       <table class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:80%;">\n        <caption class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Lakewood_church.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1300" data-file-width="2027" height="141" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lakewood_church.jpg/220px-Lakewood_church.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lakewood_church.jpg/330px-Lakewood_church.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lakewood_church.jpg/440px-Lakewood_church.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Lakewood_church.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         The\n         <a href="/wiki/Lakewood_Church" title="Lakewood Church">\n          Lakewood Church\n         </a>\n         in\n         <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">\n          Houston\n         </a>\n         is the largest church in the United States.\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church (4,673,500); the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_Baptist_Convention" title="Southern Baptist Convention">\n        Southern Baptist Convention\n       </a>\n       (3,721,318); the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Methodist_Church" title="United Methodist Church">\n        United Methodist Church\n       </a>\n       with (1,035,168); and\n       <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">\n        Islam\n       </a>\n       (421,972).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-www.thearda.com_240-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-www.thearda.com-240">\n         [238]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Known as the buckle of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Bible_Belt" title="Bible Belt">\n        Bible Belt\n       </a>\n       , East Texas is socially conservative.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-abstinence_241-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-abstinence-241">\n         [239]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas%E2%80%93Fort_Worth_metroplex" title="Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth metroplex">\n        Dallas\xe2\x80\x93Fort Worth metroplex\n       </a>\n       is home to three major evangelical seminaries and a host of Bible schools.\n       <a href="/wiki/Lakewood_Church" title="Lakewood Church">\n        Lakewood Church\n       </a>\n       in Houston, boasts the largest attendance in the nation averaging more than 43,000 weekly.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-242">\n        <a href="#cite_note-242">\n         [240]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Adherents of many other religions reside predominantly in the urban centers of Texas. In 1990, the Islamic population was about 140,000 with more recent figures putting the current number of Muslims between 350,000 and 400,000.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-243">\n        <a href="#cite_note-243">\n         [241]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The Jewish population is around 128,000.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-244">\n        <a href="#cite_note-244">\n         [242]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Around 146,000 adherents of religions such as\n       <a href="/wiki/Hinduism" title="Hinduism">\n        Hinduism\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Sikhism" title="Sikhism">\n        Sikhism\n       </a>\n       live in Texas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-245">\n        <a href="#cite_note-245">\n         [243]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       It is the fifth-largest\n       <a href="/wiki/Muslim" title="Muslim">\n        Muslim\n       </a>\n       -populated state in the country.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-246">\n        <a href="#cite_note-246">\n         [244]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Culture">\n        Culture\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Texas" title="Culture of Texas">\n        Culture of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_people_from_Texas" title="List of people from Texas">\n        List of people from Texas\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Texas_symbols" title="List of Texas symbols">\n        List of Texas symbols\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1440" data-file-width="2160" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg/220px-Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg/330px-Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg/440px-Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Mission_San_Antonio_aka_Alamo.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Alamo_Mission_in_San_Antonio" title="Alamo Mission in San Antonio">\n          The Alamo\n         </a>\n         is one of the most recognized symbols of Texas.\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Historically, Texas culture comes from a blend of Southern\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n        (Dixie)\n       </a>\n       , Western\n       <a href="/wiki/Frontier_Strip" title="Frontier Strip">\n        (frontier)\n       </a>\n       , and Southwestern\n       <a href="/wiki/Southwestern_United_States" title="Southwestern United States">\n        (Mexican/Anglo fusion)\n       </a>\n       influences, varying in degrees of such from one intrastate region to another. Texas is placed in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n        Southern United States\n       </a>\n       by the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">\n        United States Census Bureau\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-regdiv_247-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-regdiv-247">\n         [245]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       A popular food item, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Breakfast_burrito" title="Breakfast burrito">\n        breakfast burrito\n       </a>\n       , draws from all three, having a soft flour tortilla wrapped around bacon and scrambled eggs or other hot, cooked fillings. Adding to Texas\'s traditional culture, established in the 18th and 19th centuries, immigration has made Texas a\n       <a href="/wiki/Melting_pot" title="Melting pot">\n        melting pot\n       </a>\n       of cultures from around the world.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas has made a strong mark on national and international pop culture. The state is strongly associated with the image of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Cowboy" title="Cowboy">\n        cowboy\n       </a>\n       shown in\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Westerns" title="Westerns">\n        westerns\n       </a>\n       and in\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Country_western_music" title="Country western music">\n        country western music\n       </a>\n       . The state\'s numerous oil tycoons are also a popular pop culture topic as seen in the hit TV series\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_(1978_TV_series)" title="Dallas (1978 TV series)">\n        <i>\n         Dallas\n        </i>\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The internationally known slogan "\n       <a href="/wiki/Don%27t_Mess_with_Texas" title="Don\'t Mess with Texas">\n        Don\'t Mess with Texas\n       </a>\n       " began as an anti-littering\n       <a href="/wiki/Advertising_campaign" title="Advertising campaign">\n        advertisement\n       </a>\n       . Since the campaign\'s inception in 1986, the phrase has become "an identity statement, a declaration of Texas swagger".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DMWTexas_248-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DMWTexas-248">\n         [246]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Texas_self-perception">\n        Texas self-perception\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       "Texas-sized" is an expression that can be used in two ways: to describe something that is about the size of the\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">\n        U.S. state\n       </a>\n       of Texas,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-249">\n        <a href="#cite_note-249">\n         [247]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-250">\n        <a href="#cite_note-250">\n         [248]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       or to describe something (usually but not always originating from Texas) that is large compared to other objects of its type.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-251">\n        <a href="#cite_note-251">\n         [249]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-252">\n        <a href="#cite_note-252">\n         [250]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-253">\n        <a href="#cite_note-253">\n         [251]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas was the largest U.S. state, until\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n        Alaska\n       </a>\n       became a state in 1959. The phrase, "everything is bigger in Texas," has been in regular use since at least 1950;\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-254">\n        <a href="#cite_note-254">\n         [252]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and was used as early as 1913.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-255">\n        <a href="#cite_note-255">\n         [253]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Arts">\n        Arts\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/Music_of_Texas" title="Music of Texas">\n        Music of Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Big_Tex.JPG">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1200" data-file-width="800" height="255" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Big_Tex.JPG/170px-Big_Tex.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Big_Tex.JPG/255px-Big_Tex.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Big_Tex.JPG/340px-Big_Tex.JPG 2x" width="170"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Big_Tex.JPG" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Big_Tex" title="Big Tex">\n          Big Tex\n         </a>\n         presided over every\n         <a href="/wiki/State_Fair_of_Texas" title="State Fair of Texas">\n          Texas State Fair\n         </a>\n         since 1952 until it was destroyed by fire in 2012\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Houston is one of only five American cities with permanent professional resident companies in all of the major performing arts disciplines: the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Grand_Opera" title="Houston Grand Opera">\n        Houston Grand Opera\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Houston_Symphony_Orchestra" title="Houston Symphony Orchestra">\n        Houston Symphony Orchestra\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Ballet" title="Houston Ballet">\n        Houston Ballet\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Alley_Theatre" title="The Alley Theatre">\n        The Alley Theatre\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-houstontheater_256-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-houstontheater-256">\n         [254]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Known for the vibrancy of its\n       <a href="/wiki/Visual_arts" title="Visual arts">\n        visual\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Performing_arts" title="Performing arts">\n        performing arts\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Theater_District" title="Houston Theater District">\n        Houston Theater District\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94a 17-block area in the heart of\n       <a href="/wiki/Downtown_Houston" title="Downtown Houston">\n        Downtown Houston\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94 ranks second in the country in the number of theater seats in a concentrated downtown area, with 12,948 seats for live performances and 1,480 movie seats.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-houstontheater_256-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-houstontheater-256">\n         [254]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Founded in 1892,\n       <a href="/wiki/Modern_Art_Museum_of_Fort_Worth" title="Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth">\n        Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth\n       </a>\n       , also called "The Modern", is Texas\'s oldest art museum. Fort Worth also has the\n       <a href="/wiki/Kimbell_Art_Museum" title="Kimbell Art Museum">\n        Kimbell Art Museum\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Amon_Carter_Museum" title="Amon Carter Museum">\n        Amon Carter Museum\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/National_Cowgirl_Museum_and_Hall_of_Fame" title="National Cowgirl Museum and Hall of Fame">\n        National Cowgirl Museum and Hall of Fame\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Will_Rogers_Memorial_Center" title="Will Rogers Memorial Center">\n        Will Rogers Memorial Center\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bass_Performance_Hall" title="Bass Performance Hall">\n        Bass Performance Hall\n       </a>\n       downtown. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Arts_District,_Dallas" title="Arts District, Dallas">\n        Arts District\n       </a>\n       of\n       <a href="/wiki/Downtown_Dallas" title="Downtown Dallas">\n        Downtown Dallas\n       </a>\n       has arts venues such as the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Museum_of_Art" title="Dallas Museum of Art">\n        Dallas Museum of Art\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Morton_H._Meyerson_Symphony_Center" title="Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center">\n        Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Margot_and_Bill_Winspear_Opera_House" title="The Margot and Bill Winspear Opera House">\n        the Margot and Bill Winspear Opera House\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Trammell_%26_Margaret_Crow_Collection_of_Asian_Art" title="The Trammell &amp; Margaret Crow Collection of Asian Art">\n        the Trammell &amp; Margaret Crow Collection of Asian Art\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Nasher_Sculpture_Center" title="Nasher Sculpture Center">\n        Nasher Sculpture Center\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dallasarts_257-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Dallasarts-257">\n         [255]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Deep_Ellum" title="Deep Ellum">\n        Deep Ellum\n       </a>\n       district within Dallas became popular during the 1920s and 1930s as the prime\n       <a href="/wiki/Jazz" title="Jazz">\n        jazz\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Blues" title="Blues">\n        blues\n       </a>\n       hotspot in the Southern United States.
