The name Deep Ellum comes from local people pronouncing "Deep Elm" as "Deep Ellum".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DeepElm_258-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DeepElm-258">\n         [256]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Artists such as\n       <a href="/wiki/Blind_Lemon_Jefferson" title="Blind Lemon Jefferson">\n        Blind Lemon Jefferson\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Robert_Johnson_(musician)" title="Robert Johnson (musician)">\n        Robert Johnson\n       </a>\n       , Huddie "\n       <a href="/wiki/Lead_Belly" title="Lead Belly">\n        Lead Belly\n       </a>\n       " Ledbetter, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Bessie_Smith" title="Bessie Smith">\n        Bessie Smith\n       </a>\n       played in early Deep Ellum clubs.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DeepElm2_259-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DeepElm2-259">\n         [257]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Austin,\n       <i>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Music_of_Austin" title="Music of Austin">\n         The Live Music Capital of the World\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       , boasts "more live music venues per capita than such music hotbeds as Nashville, Memphis, Los Angeles, Las Vegas or New York City."\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-livemusic_260-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-livemusic-260">\n         [258]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The city\'s music revolves around the\n       <a href="/wiki/Nightclub" title="Nightclub">\n        nightclubs\n       </a>\n       on\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/6th_Street_(Austin)" title="6th Street (Austin)">\n        6th Street\n       </a>\n       ; events like the film, music, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Multimedia" title="Multimedia">\n        multimedia\n       </a>\n       festival\n       <a href="/wiki/South_by_Southwest" title="South by Southwest">\n        South by Southwest\n       </a>\n       ; the longest-running concert music program on American television,\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Austin_City_Limits" title="Austin City Limits">\n         Austin City Limits\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       ; and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Austin_City_Limits_Music_Festival" title="Austin City Limits Music Festival">\n        Austin City Limits Music Festival\n       </a>\n       held in\n       <a href="/wiki/Zilker_Park" title="Zilker Park">\n        Zilker Park\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-AustinCL_261-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-AustinCL-261">\n         [259]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Since 1980, San Antonio has evolved into "The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tejano_Music" title="Tejano Music">\n        Tejano Music\n       </a>\n       Capital Of The World."\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TTMA_262-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TTMA-262">\n         [260]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Tejano_Music_Awards" title="Tejano Music Awards">\n        Tejano Music Awards\n       </a>\n       have provided a forum to create greater awareness and appreciation for Tejano music and culture.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TejanoMA_263-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TejanoMA-263">\n         [261]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div style="clear:both;">\n      </div>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Education">\n        Education\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Education_in_Texas" title="Education in Texas">\n        Education in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The second\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Presidents_of_the_Republic_of_Texas" title="List of Presidents of the Republic of Texas">\n        president of the Republic of Texas\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Mirabeau_B._Lamar" title="Mirabeau B. Lamar">\n        Mirabeau B. Lamar\n       </a>\n       , is the\n       <i>\n        Father of Texas Education\n       </i>\n       . During his term, the state set aside three\n       <a href="/wiki/League_(unit)" title="League (unit)">\n        leagues\n       </a>\n       of land in each county for equipping public schools. An additional 50 leagues of land set aside for the support of two universities would later become the basis of the state\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Permanent_University_Fund" title="Permanent University Fund">\n        Permanent University Fund\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PUF_264-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PUF-264">\n         [262]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Lamar\'s actions set the foundation for a Texas-wide public school system.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-hen37_265-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-hen37-265">\n         [263]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Between 2006 and 2007, Texas spent $7,275 per pupil ranking it below the national average of $9,389. The pupil/teacher ratio was 14.9, below the national average of 15.3. Texas paid instructors $41,744, below the national average of $46,593. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Education_Agency" title="Texas Education Agency">\n        Texas Education Agency\n       </a>\n       (TEA) administers the state\'s public school systems. Texas has\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_school_districts_in_Texas" title="List of school districts in Texas">\n        over 1,000\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/School_district" title="School district">\n        school districts\n       </a>\n       - all districts except the\n       <a href="/wiki/Stafford_Municipal_School_District" title="Stafford Municipal School District">\n        Stafford Municipal School District\n       </a>\n       are independent from municipal government and many cross city boundaries.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Stafford_266-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Stafford-266">\n         [264]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       School districts have the power to\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Taxation" title="Taxation">\n        tax\n       </a>\n       their residents and to assert\n       <a href="/wiki/Eminent_domain" title="Eminent domain">\n        eminent domain\n       </a>\n       over privately owned property. Due to court-mandated equitable school financing for school districts, the state has a controversial tax redistribution system called the"\n       <a href="/wiki/Robin_Hood_plan" title="Robin Hood plan">\n        Robin Hood plan\n       </a>\n       ". This plan transfers property tax revenue from wealthy school districts to poor ones.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-robinhood_267-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-robinhood-267">\n         [265]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The TEA has no authority over private or\n       <a href="/wiki/Homeschooling" title="Homeschooling">\n        home school\n       </a>\n       activities.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-homeschool_268-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-homeschool-268">\n         [266]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Students in Texas take the\n       <a href="/wiki/State_of_Texas_Assessments_of_Academic_Readiness" title="State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness">\n        State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness\n       </a>\n       (STAAR) in primary and secondary school. STAAR assess students\' attainment of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Reading_(activity)" title="Reading (activity)">\n        reading\n       </a>\n       , writing,\n       <a href="/wiki/Mathematics" title="Mathematics">\n        mathematics\n       </a>\n       , science, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Social_studies" title="Social studies">\n        social studies\n       </a>\n       skills required under Texas education standards and the\n       <a href="/wiki/No_Child_Left_Behind_Act" title="No Child Left Behind Act">\n        No Child Left Behind Act\n       </a>\n       . The test replaced the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Assessment_of_Knowledge_and_Skills" title="Texas Assessment of Knowledge and Skills">\n        Texas Assessment of Knowledge and Skills\n       </a>\n       (TAKS) test in the 2011\xe2\x80\x932012 school year.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TAKS_269-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TAKS-269">\n         [267]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div style="clear:both;">\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Although unusual in the West,\n       <a href="/wiki/School_corporal_punishment" title="School corporal punishment">\n        school corporal punishment\n       </a>\n       is not uncommon in more conservative areas of the state, with 28,569 public school students\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-270">\n        <a href="#cite_note-270">\n         [268]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Paddle_(spanking)" title="Paddle (spanking)">\n        paddled\n       </a>\n       at least one time, according to government data for the 2011\xe2\x80\x932012 school year.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CORPUN_US_SCHOOL_271-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CORPUN_US_SCHOOL-271">\n         [269]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The rate of school corporal punishment in Texas is surpassed only by Mississippi, Alabama, and Arkansas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CORPUN_US_SCHOOL_271-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CORPUN_US_SCHOOL-271">\n         [269]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Higher_education">\n        Higher education\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="426" data-file-width="640" height="146" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg/220px-The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg/330px-The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg/440px-The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin_-_Littlefield_Fountain_and_Main_Building.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_at_Austin" title="University of Texas at Austin">\n          The University of Texas at Austin\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_colleges_and_universities_in_Texas" title="List of colleges and universities in Texas">\n        List of colleges and universities in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The state\'s two most widely recognized flagship universities are\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin" title="The University of Texas at Austin">\n        The University of Texas at Austin\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_University" title="Texas A&amp;M University">\n        Texas A&amp;M University\n       </a>\n       , ranked as the 52nd\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-272">\n        <a href="#cite_note-272">\n         [270]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and 69th\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-273">\n        <a href="#cite_note-273">\n         [271]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       best universities in the nation according to the 2014 edition of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/US_News_and_World_Report" title="US News and World Report">\n        U.S. News &amp; World Report\'s\n       </a>\n       "Best Colleges", respectively. Some observers\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Tier_One_1_274-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Tier_One_1-274">\n         [272]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       also include the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Houston" title="University of Houston">\n        University of Houston\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Tech_University" title="Texas Tech University">\n        Texas Tech University\n       </a>\n       as tier one flagships alongside UT Austin and A&amp;M.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Tier_One_3_275-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Tier_One_3-275">\n         [273]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Tier_One_4_276-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Tier_One_4-276">\n         [274]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Higher_Education_Coordinating_Board" title="Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board">\n        Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board\n       </a>\n       (THECB) ranks the state\'s public universities into three distinct tiers:\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UT_System_Tier_One_277-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UT_System_Tier_One-277">\n         [275]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        National Research Universities (Tier 1)\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-278">\n         <a href="#cite_note-278">\n          [276]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        <ul>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_Austin" title="The University of Texas at Austin">\n           The University of Texas at Austin\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_University" title="Texas A&amp;M University">\n           Texas A&amp;M University\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a href="/wiki/Texas_Tech_University" title="Texas Tech University">\n           Texas Tech University\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a href="/wiki/University_of_Houston" title="University of Houston">\n           University of Houston\n          </a>\n         </li>\n        </ul>\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        Emerging Research Universities (Tier 2)\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UT_System_Tier_One_277-1">\n         <a href="#cite_note-UT_System_Tier_One-277">\n          [275]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        <ul>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_Arlington" title="The University of Texas at Arlington">\n           The University of Texas at Arlington\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_Dallas" title="The University of Texas at Dallas">\n           The University of Texas at Dallas\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_El_Paso" title="The University of Texas at El Paso">\n           The University of Texas at El Paso\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_at_San_Antonio" title="The University of Texas at San Antonio">\n           The University of Texas at San Antonio\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_North_Texas" title="The University of North Texas">\n           The University of North Texas\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li>\n          <a href="/wiki/Texas_State_University" title="Texas State University">\n           Texas State University\n          </a>\n         </li>\n        </ul>\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        Comprehensive Universities (Tier 3)\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UT_System_Tier_One_277-2">\n         <a href="#cite_note-UT_System_Tier_One-277">\n          [275]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        <ul>\n         <li>\n          All other public universities (25 in total)\n         </li>\n        </ul>\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <p>\n       Texas\'s controversial alternative affirmative action plan,\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_House_Bill_588" title="Texas House Bill 588">\n        Texas House Bill 588\n       </a>\n       , guarantees Texas students who graduated in the\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        top 10\n       </span>\n       percent of their high school class automatic admission to state-funded universities. The bill encourages demographic diversity while avoiding problems stemming from the\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Hopwood_v._Texas" title="Hopwood v. Texas">\n         Hopwood v. Texas\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       (1996) case.\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:TAMUcampus.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="477" data-file-width="699" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/TAMUcampus.jpg/220px-TAMUcampus.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/TAMUcampus.jpg/330px-TAMUcampus.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/TAMUcampus.jpg/440px-TAMUcampus.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:TAMUcampus.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_University" title="Texas A&amp;M University">\n          Texas A&amp;M University\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Thirty-six (36) separate and distinct public universities exist in Texas, of which 32 belong to one of the six state university systems.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UniSystems_279-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UniSystems-279">\n         [277]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-unisystems2_280-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-unisystems2-280">\n         [278]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Discovery of minerals on\n       <a href="/wiki/Permanent_University_Fund" title="Permanent University Fund">\n        Permanent University Fund\n       </a>\n       land, particularly oil, has helped fund the rapid growth of the state\'s two largest university systems: the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_System" title="University of Texas System">\n        University of Texas System\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_University_System" title="Texas A&amp;M University System">\n        Texas A&amp;M System\n       </a>\n       . The four other university systems: the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Houston_System" title="University of Houston System">\n        University of Houston System\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_North_Texas_System" title="University of North Texas System">\n        University of North Texas System\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_State_University_System" title="Texas State University System">\n        Texas State System\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Tech_University_System" title="Texas Tech University System">\n        Texas Tech System\n       </a>\n       are not funded by the Permanent University Fund.\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_(Alternate).JPG">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2432" data-file-width="3648" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG/220px-Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG/330px-Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG/440px-Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_%28Alternate%29.JPG 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ezekiel_W._Cullen_Building_(Alternate).JPG" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/University_of_Houston" title="University of Houston">\n          University of Houston\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The Carnegie Foundation classifies three of Texas\'s universities as Tier One research institutions:\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_at_Austin" title="University of Texas at Austin">\n        The University of Texas at Austin\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_University" title="Texas A&amp;M University">\n        Texas A&amp;M University\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Houston" title="University of Houston">\n        University of Houston\n       </a>\n       . The University of Texas at Austin and Texas A&amp;M University are flagship universities of the state of Texas. Both were established by the Texas Constitution and hold stakes in the Permanent University Fund. The state has been putting effort to expand the number of flagship universities by elevating some of its seven institutions designated as "emerging research universities." The two that are expected to emerge first are the University of Houston and Texas Tech University, likely in that order according to discussions on the House floor of the 82nd Texas Legislature.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-281">\n        <a href="#cite_note-281">\n         [279]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Lovett_Hall.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="492" data-file-width="800" height="135" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Lovett_Hall.jpg/220px-Lovett_Hall.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Lovett_Hall.jpg/330px-Lovett_Hall.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Lovett_Hall.jpg/440px-Lovett_Hall.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Lovett_Hall.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/Rice_University" title="Rice University">\n          Rice University\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The state is home to various private institutions of higher learning\xe2\x80\x94ranging from liberal arts colleges to a nationally recognized top-tier research university.\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Rice_University" title="Rice University">\n         Rice University\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       in Houston is one of the leading teaching and research universities of the United States and is ranked the nation\'s 17th-best overall university by\n       <i>\n        U.S. News &amp; World Report\n       </i>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-282">\n        <a href="#cite_note-282">\n         [280]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Trinity_University_(Texas)" title="Trinity University (Texas)">\n        Trinity University\n       </a>\n       , a private, primarily undergraduate liberal arts university in San Antonio, has ranked first among universities granting primarily bachelor\'s and select master\'s degrees in the Western United States for 20 consecutive years by\n       <i>\n        U.S. News\n       </i>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-283">\n        <a href="#cite_note-283">\n         [281]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Private universities include\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Austin_College" title="Austin College">\n         Austin College\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Baylor_University" title="Baylor University">\n         Baylor University\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       ,\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/University_of_Mary_Hardin%E2%80%93Baylor" title="University of Mary Hardin\xe2\x80\x93Baylor">\n         University of Mary Hardin\xe2\x80\x93Baylor\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       , and\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Southwestern_University" title="Southwestern University">\n         Southwestern University\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-privateuni_284-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-privateuni-284">\n         [282]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-southwestern_285-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-southwestern-285">\n         [283]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-austincollege_286-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-austincollege-286">\n         [284]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Universities in Texas host three presidential libraries:\n       <a href="/wiki/George_Bush_Presidential_Library" title="George Bush Presidential Library">\n        George Bush Presidential Library\n       </a>\n       at Texas A&amp;M University, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Lyndon_Baines_Johnson_Library_and_Museum" title="Lyndon Baines Johnson Library and Museum">\n        Lyndon Baines Johnson Library and Museum\n       </a>\n       at The University of Texas at Austin, and the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/George_W._Bush_Presidential_Library" title="George W. Bush Presidential Library">\n        George W. Bush Presidential Library\n       </a>\n       at\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_Methodist_University" title="Southern Methodist University">\n        Southern Methodist University\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <div style="clear:both;">\n      </div>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Media">\n        Media\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <table class="plainlinks metadata ambox mbox-small-left ambox-content" role="presentation">\n       <tr>\n        <td class="mbox-image">\n         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg">\n          <img alt="[icon]" data-file-height="31" data-file-width="44" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/20px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/30px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/40px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 2x" width="20"/>\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td class="mbox-text">\n         <div class="mbox-text-span">\n          <b>\n           This section needs expansion\n          </b>\n          .\n          <small>\n           You can help by\n           <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Texas&amp;action=edit&amp;section=">\n            adding to it\n           </a>\n           .\n          </small>\n          <small>\n           <i>\n            (March 2017)\n           </i>\n          </small>\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/Category:Texas_media" title="Category:Texas media">\n        Category:Texas media\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Healthcare">\n        Healthcare\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_hospitals_in_Texas" title="List of hospitals in Texas">\n        List of hospitals in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Notwithstanding the concentration of elite medical centers located in the state,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Commonwealth_Fund" title="The Commonwealth Fund">\n        The Commonwealth Fund\n       </a>\n       ranks the Texas\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Healthcare_system" title="Healthcare system">\n        healthcare system\n       </a>\n       the third worst in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-insurancenet_287-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-insurancenet-287">\n         [285]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas ranks close to last in access to healthcare, quality of care, avoidable hospital spending, and equity among various groups.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-insurancenet_287-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-insurancenet-287">\n         [285]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Causes of the state\'s poor rankings include politics, a high poverty rate, and the highest rate of illegal immigration in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CausesHealthcare_198-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CausesHealthcare-198">\n         [196]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In May 2006, Texas initiated the program "code red" in response to the report that the state had 25.1 percent of the population without health insurance, the largest proportion in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-codered_288-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-codered-288">\n         [286]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas also has controversial\n       <a href="/wiki/Non-economic_damages_caps" title="Non-economic damages caps">\n        non-economic damages caps\n       </a>\n       for\n       <a href="/wiki/Medical_malpractice" title="Medical malpractice">\n        medical malpractice\n       </a>\n       lawsuits, set at $250,000, in an attempt to "curb rising malpractice premiums, and control escalating healthcare costs".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-tort_289-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-tort-289">\n         [287]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Trust_for_America%27s_Health" title="Trust for America\'s Health">\n        Trust for America\'s Health\n       </a>\n       ranked Texas 15th highest in adult\n       <a href="/wiki/Obesity" title="Obesity">\n        obesity\n       </a>\n       , with 27.2 percent of the state\'s population\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Measured" title="Measured">\n        measured\n       </a>\n       as obese.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-healthyamericans_290-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-healthyamericans-290">\n         [288]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The 2008\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Men%27s_Health_(magazine)" title="Men\'s Health (magazine)">\n        Men\'s Health\n       </a>\n       obesity survey ranked four Texas cities among the top 25 fattest cities in America; Houston ranked 6th, Dallas 7th, El Paso 8th, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Arlington,_Texas" title="Arlington, Texas">\n        Arlington\n       </a>\n       14th.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-obese2_291-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-obese2-291">\n         [289]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas had only one city, Austin, ranked 21st, in the top 25 among the "fittest cities" in America.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-obese2_291-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-obese2-291">\n         [289]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The same survey has evaluated the state\'s obesity initiatives favorably with a "B+".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-obese2_291-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-obese2-291">\n         [289]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The state is ranked forty-second in the percentage of residents who engage in regular exercise.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-292">\n        <a href="#cite_note-292">\n         [290]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas has the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Maternal_Healthcare_System_in_Texas" title="Maternal Healthcare System in Texas">\n        highest maternal mortality rate\n       </a>\n       in the developed world, and the rate by which Texas women died from pregnancy related complications doubled from 2010 to 2014, to 23.8 per 100,000. A rate unmatched in any other U.S. state or economically developed country.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-293">\n        <a href="#cite_note-293">\n         [291]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Medical_research">\n        Medical research\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <p>\n       Many elite research medical centers are located in Texas. The state has nine\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_colleges_and_universities_in_Texas#Health_science" title="List of colleges and universities in Texas">\n        medical schools\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MedicalSchools_294-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MedicalSchools-294">\n         [292]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       three dental schools,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-dentalschool_295-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-dentalschool-295">\n         [293]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and two\n       <a href="/wiki/Optometry" title="Optometry">\n        optometry\n       </a>\n       schools.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-optometry_296-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-optometry-296">\n         [294]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas has two\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Biosafety_Level_4" title="Biosafety Level 4">\n        Biosafety Level 4\n       </a>\n       (BSL-4) laboratories: one at\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_University_of_Texas_Medical_Branch" title="The University of Texas Medical Branch">\n        The University of Texas Medical Branch\n       </a>\n       (UTMB) in Galveston,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-biosafety4_297-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-biosafety4-297">\n         [295]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and the other at the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Southwest_Foundation_for_Biomedical_Research" title="Southwest Foundation for Biomedical Research">\n        Southwest Foundation for Biomedical Research\n       </a>\n       in San Antonio\xe2\x80\x94the first privately owned BSL-4 lab in the United States.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-biosafety4_2_298-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-biosafety4_2-298">\n         [296]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Medical_Center" title="Texas Medical Center">\n        Texas Medical Center\n       </a>\n       in Houston, holds the world\'s largest concentration of research and healthcare institutions, with 47 member institutions.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TexasMC_299-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TexasMC-299">\n         [297]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas Medical Center performs the most heart transplants in the world.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HeartTransplants_300-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-HeartTransplants-300">\n         [298]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_M._D._Anderson_Cancer_Center" title="University of Texas M. D. Anderson Cancer Center">\n        University of Texas M. D. Anderson Cancer Center\n       </a>\n       in Houston is a highly regarded academic institution that centers around cancer patient care, research, education and prevention.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MDAnderson_301-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MDAnderson-301">\n         [299]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       San Antonio\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/South_Texas_Medical_Center" title="South Texas Medical Center">\n        South Texas Medical Center\n       </a>\n       facilities rank sixth in clinical medicine research impact in the United States.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UTSAFactsheet_302-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UTSAFactsheet-302">\n         [300]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/UTHSCSA" title="UTHSCSA">\n        University of Texas Health Science Center\n       </a>\n       is another highly ranked research and educational institution in San Antonio.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DentalSchool_303-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DentalSchool-303">\n         [301]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Tmedicialcenter2_304-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Tmedicialcenter2-304">\n         [302]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Both the\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Heart_Association" title="American Heart Association">\n        American Heart Association\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_Southwestern_Medical_Center" title="University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center">\n        University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center\n       </a>\n       call Dallas home. The Southwestern Medical Center ranks "among the top academic medical centers in the world".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UTSWAboutUs_305-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UTSWAboutUs-305">\n         [303]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/University_of_Texas_Southwestern_Medical_School" title="University of Texas Southwestern Medical School">\n        institution\'s medical school\n       </a>\n       employs the most medical school\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nobel_laureates" title="Nobel laureates">\n        Nobel laureates\n       </a>\n       in the world.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UTSWAboutUs_305-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UTSWAboutUs-305">\n         [303]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UTSWFactsheet_306-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UTSWFactsheet-306">\n         [304]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Transportation">\n        Transportation\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Transportation_in_Texas" title="Transportation in Texas">\n        Transportation in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:High_Five.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2667" data-file-width="2000" height="333" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/High_Five.jpg/250px-High_Five.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/High_Five.jpg/375px-High_Five.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/High_Five.jpg/500px-High_Five.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:High_Five.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         The\n         <a href="/wiki/High_Five_Interchange" title="High Five Interchange">\n          High Five Interchange\n         </a>\n         in\n         <a href="/wiki/Dallas" title="Dallas">\n          Dallas\n         </a>\n         is a five level interchange.\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Texans have historically had difficulties traversing Texas due to the state\'s large size and rough terrain. Texas has compensated by building both America\'s largest highway and railway systems in length. The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Regulatory_authority" title="Regulatory authority">\n        regulatory authority\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Department_of_Transportation" title="Texas Department of Transportation">\n        Texas Department of Transportation\n       </a>\n       (TxDOT) maintains the state\'s immense highway system, regulates aviation,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-texdotaviation_307-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-texdotaviation-307">\n         [305]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Public_transportation" title="Public transportation">\n        public transportation\n       </a>\n       systems.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-texdottransport_308-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-texdottransport-308">\n         [306]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Located centrally in North America, the state is an important\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Transportation_hub" title="Transportation hub">\n        transportation hub\n       </a>\n       . From the Dallas/Fort Worth area, trucks can reach 93 percent of the nation\'s population within 48 hours, and 37 percent within 24 hours.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-JDFTransport_309-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-JDFTransport-309">\n         [307]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas has 33\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Special_Economic_Zone" title="Special Economic Zone">\n        foreign trade zones\n       </a>\n       (FTZ), the most in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FTZ1_310-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FTZ1-310">\n         [308]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2004, a combined total of $298 billion of goods passed though Texas FTZs.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FTZ1_310-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FTZ1-310">\n         [308]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Highways">\n        Highways\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Texas_state_highways" title="Texas state highways">\n        Texas state highways\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Welcome_to_Texas_sign,_2008.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1222" data-file-width="1711" height="179" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg/250px-Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg/375px-Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg/500px-Welcome_to_Texas_sign%2C_2008.jpg 2x" width="250"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Welcome_to_Texas_sign,_2008.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         "Welcome to Texas" road sign\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The first Texas freeway was the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gulf_Freeway" title="Gulf Freeway">\n        Gulf Freeway\n       </a>\n       opened in 1948 in Houston.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-txfwy_311-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-txfwy-311">\n         [309]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       As of 2005, 79,535 miles (127,999\xc2\xa0km) of public highway crisscrossed Texas (up from 71,000 miles (114,263\xc2\xa0km) in 1984).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-highwaymiles_312-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-highwaymiles-312">\n         [310]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       To fund recent growth in the state highways, Texas has 17 toll roads (see\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Toll_Roads_in_the_United_States#Texas" title="List of Toll Roads in the United States">\n        list\n       </a>\n       ) with several additional\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tollway" title="Tollway">\n        tollways\n       </a>\n       proposed.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-tollways2_313-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-tollways2-313">\n         [311]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In central Texas, the southern section of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_State_Highway_130" title="Texas State Highway 130">\n        State Highway 130\n       </a>\n       toll road has a speed limit of 85 miles per hour (137\xc2\xa0km/h), the highest in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-abcnews-130open_314-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-abcnews-130open-314">\n         [312]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       All federal and state highways in Texas are paved.\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Airports">\n        Airports\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_airports_in_Texas" title="List of airports in Texas">\n        List of airports in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Texas has 730 airports, second most of any state in the nation. Largest in Texas by size and passengers served,\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas/Fort_Worth_International_Airport" title="Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport">\n        Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport\n       </a>\n       (DFW) is the second largest by area in the United States, and fourth in the world with 18,076 acres (73.15\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DFWAir_315-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DFWAir-315">\n         [313]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In traffic, DFW is the busiest in the state, the fourth busiest in the United States,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GreatPlacesAvi_316-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GreatPlacesAvi-316">\n         [314]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and sixth worldwide.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DFWAir2_317-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DFWAir2-317">\n         [315]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Airlines_Group" title="American Airlines Group">\n        American Airlines Group\n       </a>\n       \'s\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Airlines" title="American Airlines">\n        American\n       </a>\n       /\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/American_Eagle_Airlines" title="American Eagle Airlines">\n        American Eagle\n       </a>\n       , the world\'s largest airline in total passengers-miles transported and passenger fleet size,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-318">\n        <a href="#cite_note-318">\n         [316]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       uses DFW as its largest and main\n       <a href="/wiki/Airline_hub" title="Airline hub">\n        hub\n       </a>\n       .\n       <a href="/wiki/Southwest_Airlines" title="Southwest Airlines">\n        Southwest Airlines\n       </a>\n       , headquartered in Dallas, has its operations at\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Love_Field" title="Dallas Love Field">\n        Dallas Love Field\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SW1_319-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-SW1-319">\n         [317]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       It ranks as the largest airline in the United States by number of passengers carried domestically per year and the\n       <a href="/wiki/World%27s_largest_airlines#Scheduled_domestic_passengers_carried" title="World\'s largest airlines">\n        largest airline in the world\n       </a>\n       by number of passengers carried.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IATA_320-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-IATA-320">\n         [318]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texas\'s second-largest air facility is Houston\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/George_Bush_Intercontinental_Airport" title="George Bush Intercontinental Airport">\n        George Bush Intercontinental Airport\n       </a>\n       (IAH). It served as the largest hub for the former\n       <a href="/wiki/Continental_Airlines" title="Continental Airlines">\n        Continental Airlines\n       </a>\n       , which was based in Houston; it serves as the largest hub for\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Airlines" title="United Airlines">\n        United Airlines\n       </a>\n       , the world\'s third-largest airline, by passenger-miles flown.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-321">\n        <a href="#cite_note-321">\n         [319]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-322">\n        <a href="#cite_note-322">\n         [320]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       IAH offers service to the most Mexican destinations of any U.S. airport.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GBAir1_323-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GBAir1-323">\n         [321]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GBAir2_324-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-GBAir2-324">\n         [322]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The next five largest airports in the state all serve over 3 million passengers annually; they include\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Austin-Bergstrom_International_Airport" title="Austin-Bergstrom International Airport">\n        Austin-Bergstrom International Airport\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/William_P._Hobby_Airport" title="William P. Hobby Airport">\n        William P. Hobby Airport\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio_International_Airport" title="San Antonio International Airport">\n        San Antonio International Airport\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Love_Field" title="Dallas Love Field">\n        Dallas Love Field\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/El_Paso_International_Airport" title="El Paso International Airport">\n        El Paso International Airport\n       </a>\n       . The smallest airport in the state to be designated an international airport is\n       <a href="/wiki/Del_Rio_International_Airport" title="Del Rio International Airport">\n        Del Rio International Airport\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ports">\n        Ports\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_ports_in_the_United_States" title="List of ports in the United States">\n        List of ports in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Around 1,150\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Seaports" title="Seaports">\n        seaports\n       </a>\n       dot Texas\'s coast with over 1,000 miles (1,600\xc2\xa0km) of\n       <a href="/wiki/Channel_(geography)" title="Channel (geography)">\n        channels\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ports1_325-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ports1-325">\n         [323]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Ports employ nearly one-million people and handle an average of 317 million\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Metric_tons" title="Metric tons">\n        metric tons\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-portbenefits_326-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-portbenefits-326">\n         [324]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Texas ports connect with the rest of the U.S. Atlantic seaboard with the\n       <a href="/wiki/Gulf_Intracoastal_Waterway" title="Gulf Intracoastal Waterway">\n        Gulf\n       </a>\n       section of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Intracoastal_Waterway" title="Intracoastal Waterway">\n        Intracoastal Waterway\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ports1_325-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ports1-325">\n         [323]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Houston" title="Port of Houston">\n        Port of Houston\n       </a>\n       today is the busiest port in the United States in foreign tonnage, second in overall tonnage, and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_world%27s_busiest_ports_by_cargo_tonnage" title="List of world\'s busiest ports by cargo tonnage">\n        tenth\n       </a>\n       worldwide in tonnage.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-porthouston_327-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-porthouston-327">\n         [325]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Ship_Channel" title="Houston Ship Channel">\n        Houston Ship Channel\n       </a>\n       spans 530 feet (160\xc2\xa0m) wide by 45 feet (14\xc2\xa0m) deep by 50 miles (80\xc2\xa0km) long.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HGnav_328-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-HGnav-328">\n         [326]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Railroads">\n        Railroads\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Texas_railroads" title="List of Texas railroads">\n        List of Texas railroads\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       Part of the state\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Cowboy#Texas_tradition" title="Cowboy">\n        tradition\n       </a>\n       of cowboys is derived from the massive\n       <a href="/wiki/Cattle_drives_in_the_United_States" title="Cattle drives in the United States">\n        cattle drives\n       </a>\n       which its ranchers organized in the nineteenth century to\n       <a href="/wiki/Cattle_drives_in_the_United_States" title="Cattle drives in the United States">\n        drive\n       </a>\n       livestock to railroads and markets in Kansas, for shipment to the East. Towns along the way, such as\n       <a href="/wiki/Baxter_Springs,_Kansas" title="Baxter Springs, Kansas">\n        Baxter Springs\n       </a>\n       , the first cow town in Kansas, developed to handle the seasonal workers and tens of thousands of head of cattle being driven.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The first railroad to operate in Texas was the\n       <a href="/wiki/Buffalo_Bayou,_Brazos_and_Colorado_Railway" title="Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railway">\n        Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railway\n       </a>\n       , opening in August 1853.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-329">\n        <a href="#cite_note-329">\n         [327]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The first railroad to enter Texas from the north, completed in 1872, was the\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/Missouri%E2%80%93Kansas%E2%80%93Texas_Railroad" title="Missouri\xe2\x80\x93Kansas\xe2\x80\x93Texas Railroad">\n         Missouri\xe2\x80\x93Kansas\xe2\x80\x93Texas Railroad\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-330">\n        <a href="#cite_note-330">\n         [328]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       With increasing railroad access, the ranchers did not have to take their livestock up to the Midwest, and shipped beef out from Texas. This caused a decline in the economies of the cow towns.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Since 1911, Texas has led the nation in length of railroad miles within the state. Texas railway length peaked in 1932 at 17,078 miles (27,484\xc2\xa0km), but declined to 14,006 miles (22,540\xc2\xa0km) by 2000. While the\n       <a href="/wiki/Railroad_Commission_of_Texas" title="Railroad Commission of Texas">\n        Railroad Commission of Texas\n       </a>\n       originally regulated state railroads, in 2005 the state reassigned these duties to TxDOT.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-RRCMove_331-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-RRCMove-331">\n         [329]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Both Dallas and Houston feature\n       <a href="/wiki/Light_rail" title="Light rail">\n        light rail\n       </a>\n       systems.\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Area_Rapid_Transit" title="Dallas Area Rapid Transit">\n        Dallas Area Rapid Transit\n       </a>\n       (DART) built the first light rail system in the Southwest United States, completed in 1996.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DARTLightRail_332-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-DARTLightRail-332">\n         [330]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Trinity_Railway_Express" title="Trinity Railway Express">\n        Trinity Railway Express\n       </a>\n       (TRE)\n       <a href="/wiki/Commuter_rail" title="Commuter rail">\n        commuter rail\n       </a>\n       service, which connects Fort Worth and Dallas, is provided by the\n       <a href="/wiki/Fort_Worth_Transportation_Authority" title="Fort Worth Transportation Authority">\n        Fort Worth Transportation Authority\n       </a>\n       (the T) and DART.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TRE_333-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TRE-333">\n         [331]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In the Austin area,\n       <a href="/wiki/Capital_Metropolitan_Transportation_Authority" title="Capital Metropolitan Transportation Authority">\n        Capital Metropolitan Transportation Authority\n       </a>\n       operates a commuter rail service known as\n       <a href="/wiki/Capital_MetroRail" title="Capital MetroRail">\n        Capital MetroRail\n       </a>\n       to the northwestern suburbs. The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Metropolitan_Transit_Authority_of_Harris_County,_Texas" title="Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County, Texas">\n        Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County, Texas\n       </a>\n       (METRO) operates light rail lines in the Houston area.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Amtrak" title="Amtrak">\n        Amtrak\n       </a>\n       provides Texas with limited intercity passenger rail service. Three scheduled routes serve the state: the daily\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Texas_Eagle" title="Texas Eagle">\n         Texas Eagle\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        (Chicago\xe2\x80\x93San Antonio)\n       </span>\n       ; the tri-weekly\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Sunset_Limited" title="Sunset Limited">\n         Sunset Limited\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        (New Orleans\xe2\x80\x93Los Angeles)\n       </span>\n       , with stops in Texas; and the daily\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Heartland_Flyer" title="Heartland Flyer">\n         Heartland Flyer\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        (Fort Worth\xe2\x80\x93Oklahoma City)\n       </span>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-packed">\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 249.33333333333px">\n        <div style="width: 249.33333333333px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 247.33333333333px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="1771" data-file-width="3648" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg/371px-20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg/557px-20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg/742px-20110123_DFW_terminal_D.jpg 2x" width="248"/>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           Terminal D at\n           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dallas_Fort_Worth_International_Airport" title="Dallas Fort Worth International Airport">\n            DFW Airport\n           </a>\n           in Dallas.\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">\n        <div style="width: 162px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Bush_terminal_E.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="1200" data-file-width="1600" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Bush_terminal_E.jpg/240px-Bush_terminal_E.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Bush_terminal_E.jpg/360px-Bush_terminal_E.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Bush_terminal_E.jpg/480px-Bush_terminal_E.jpg 2x" width="160"/>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           Terminal E at\n           <a href="/wiki/George_Bush_Intercontinental_Airport" title="George Bush Intercontinental Airport">\n            George Bush Intercontinental Airport\n           </a>\n           in Houston.\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 185.33333333333px">\n        <div style="width: 185.33333333333px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 183.33333333333px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="1378" data-file-width="2100" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg/275px-Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg/412px-Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg/549px-Houston_Ship_Channel.jpg 2x" width="184"/>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Houston" title="Port of Houston">\n            Port of Houston\n           </a>\n           along the\n           <a href="/wiki/Houston_Ship_Channel" title="Houston Ship Channel">\n            Houston Ship Channel\n           </a>\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-packed">\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 230px">\n        <div style="width: 230px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 228px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:METRO_Light_Rail3.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="674" data-file-width="1279" height="120" //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/METRO_Light_Rail3.jpg/684px-METRO_Light_Rail3.jpg 2x" width="228"/>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           <a href="/wiki/METRORail" title="METRORail">\n            METRORail\n           </a>\n           in Houston\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">\n        <div style="width: 162px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:DallasZooStn2.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="1224" data-file-width="1632" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/DallasZooStn2.jpg/240px-DallasZooStn2.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/DallasZooStn2.jpg/360px-DallasZooStn2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/DallasZooStn2.jpg/480px-DallasZooStn2.jpg 2x" width="160"/>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Area_Rapid_Transit" title="Dallas Area Rapid Transit">\n            DART\n           </a>\n           Rail in Dallas\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 202px">\n        <div style="width: 202px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 200px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Austin_Metrorail.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1000" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Austin_Metrorail.jpg/300px-Austin_Metrorail.jpg" class="gallerytext">\n          <p>\n           <a href="/wiki/Capital_MetroRail" title="Capital MetroRail">\n            Capital MetroRail\n           </a>\n           in Austin\n          </p>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Sports">\n        Sports\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Sports_in_Texas" title="Sports in Texas">\n        Sports in Texas\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Texas_sports_teams" title="List of Texas sports teams">\n        List of Texas sports teams\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_University_Interscholastic_League_events" title="List of University Interscholastic League events">\n        List of University Interscholastic League events\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       While\n       <a href="/wiki/American_football" title="American football">\n        American football\n       </a>\n       has long been considered "king" in the state, Texans today enjoy a wide variety of sports.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FBKing_334-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FBKing-334">\n         [332]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texans can cheer for a plethora of professional sports teams. Within the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Major_North_American_professional_sports_leagues" title="Major North American professional sports leagues">\n        "Big Four" professional leagues\n       </a>\n       , Texas has two\n       <a href="/wiki/National_Football_League" title="National Football League">\n        NFL\n       </a>\n       teams (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Cowboys" title="Dallas Cowboys">\n        Dallas Cowboys\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Texans" title="Houston Texans">\n        Houston Texans\n       </a>\n       ), two\n       <a href="/wiki/Major_League_Baseball" title="Major League Baseball">\n        Major League Baseball\n       </a>\n       teams (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Rangers_(baseball)" title="Texas Rangers (baseball)">\n        Texas Rangers\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Astros" title="Houston Astros">\n        Houston Astros\n       </a>\n       ), three\n       <a href="/wiki/National_Basketball_Association" title="National Basketball Association">\n        NBA\n       </a>\n       teams (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Rockets" title="Houston Rockets">\n        Houston Rockets\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a href="/wiki/San_Antonio_Spurs" title="San Antonio Spurs">\n        San Antonio Spurs\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Mavericks" title="Dallas Mavericks">\n        Dallas Mavericks\n       </a>\n       ), and one National Hockey League team (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Stars" title="Dallas Stars">\n        Dallas Stars\n       </a>\n       ). The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dallas_%E2%80%93_Fort_Worth_Metroplex" title="Dallas \xe2\x80\x93 Fort Worth Metroplex">\n        Dallas \xe2\x80\x93 Fort Worth Metroplex\n       </a>\n       is one of only\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._cities_with_teams_from_four_major_league_sports" title="U.S. cities with teams from four major league sports">\n        twelve American metropolitan areas that hosts sports teams from all the "Big Four" professional leagues\n       </a>\n       . Outside of the "Big Four" leagues, Texas also has two\n       <a href="/wiki/Women%27s_National_Basketball_Association" title="Women\'s National Basketball Association">\n        WNBA\n       </a>\n       teams (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas_Wings" title="Dallas Wings">\n        Dallas Wings\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/San_Antonio_Silver_Stars" title="San Antonio Silver Stars">\n        San Antonio Stars\n       </a>\n       ) and two\n       <a href="/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">\n        Major League Soccer\n       </a>\n       teams (the\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Dynamo" title="Houston Dynamo">\n        Houston Dynamo\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/FC_Dallas" title="FC Dallas">\n        FC Dallas\n       </a>\n       ).\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/College_athletics" title="College athletics">\n        Collegiate athletics\n       </a>\n       have deep significance in Texas culture, especially\n       <a href="/wiki/American_football" title="American football">\n        football\n       </a>\n       . The state has ten\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Division_I-FBS" title="Division I-FBS">\n        Division I-FBS\n       </a>\n       schools, the most in the nation. Four of the state\'s universities, the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Baylor_Bears" title="Baylor Bears">\n        Baylor Bears\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Longhorns" title="Texas Longhorns">\n        Texas Longhorns\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/TCU_Horned_Frogs" title="TCU Horned Frogs">\n        TCU Horned Frogs\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Texas_Tech_Red_Raiders" title="Texas Tech Red Raiders">\n        Texas Tech Red Raiders\n       </a>\n       , compete in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Big_12_Conference" title="Big 12 Conference">\n        Big 12 Conference\n       </a>\n       . The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M_Aggies" title="Texas A&amp;M Aggies">\n        Texas A&amp;M Aggies\n       </a>\n       left the Big 12 and joined the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southeastern_Conference" title="Southeastern Conference">\n        Southeastern Conference\n       </a>\n       in 2012, which led the Big 12 to invite TCU to join; TCU was previously in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mountain_West_Conference" title="Mountain West Conference">\n        Mountain West Conference\n       </a>\n       . The\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Cougars" title="Houston Cougars">\n        Houston Cougars\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/SMU_Mustangs" title="SMU Mustangs">\n        SMU Mustangs\n       </a>\n       compete in the\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Athletic_Conference" title="American Athletic Conference">\n        American Athletic Conference\n       </a>\n       . The\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_State_Bobcats" title="Texas State Bobcats">\n        Texas State Bobcats\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas%E2%80%93Arlington_Mavericks" title="Texas\xe2\x80\x93Arlington Mavericks">\n        UT Arlington Mavericks\n       </a>\n       compete in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Sun_Belt_Conference" title="Sun Belt Conference">\n        Sun Belt Conference\n       </a>\n       . Four of the state\'s schools claim at least one national championship in football: the Texas Longhorns, the Texas A&amp;M Aggies, the TCU Horned Frogs, and the SMU Mustangs.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       According to a survey of Division I-A coaches the\n       <a href="/wiki/College_rivalry" title="College rivalry">\n        rivalry\n       </a>\n       between the\n       <a href="/wiki/University_of_Oklahoma" title="University of Oklahoma">\n        University of Oklahoma\n       </a>\n       and the University of Texas at Austin, the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Red_River_Shootout" title="Red River Shootout">\n        Red River Shootout\n       </a>\n       , ranks the third best in the nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-RRShootout_335-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-RRShootout-335">\n         [333]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The TCU Horned Frogs and SMU Mustangs also share a rivalry and compete annually in the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Battle_for_the_Iron_Skillet" title="Battle for the Iron Skillet">\n        Battle for the Iron Skillet\n       </a>\n       . A fierce rivalry, the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lone_Star_Showdown" title="Lone Star Showdown">\n        Lone Star Showdown\n       </a>\n       , also exists between the state\'s two largest universities, Texas A&amp;M University and the University of Texas at Austin. The athletics portion of the Lone Star Showdown rivalry has been put on hold after the Texas A&amp;M Aggies joined the Southeastern Conference.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/University_Interscholastic_League" title="University Interscholastic League">\n        University Interscholastic League\n       </a>\n       (UIL) organizes most primary and secondary school competitions. Events organized by UIL include contests in athletics (the most popular being\n       <a href="/wiki/High_school_football" title="High school football">\n        high school football\n       </a>\n       ) as well as artistic and academic subjects.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UIL_336-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-UIL-336">\n         [334]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Texans also enjoy the\n       <a href="/wiki/Rodeo" title="Rodeo">\n        rodeo\n       </a>\n       . The world\'s first rodeo was hosted in\n       <a href="/wiki/Pecos,_Texas" title="Pecos, Texas">\n        Pecos, Texas\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-337">\n        <a href="#cite_note-337">\n         [335]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The annual\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston_Livestock_Show_and_Rodeo" title="Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo">\n        Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo\n       </a>\n       is the largest rodeo in the world. It begins with trail rides that originate from several points throughout the state that convene at\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Reliant_Park" title="Reliant Park">\n        Reliant Park\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HoustonRodeo_338-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-HoustonRodeo-338">\n         [336]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Southwestern_Exposition_and_Livestock_Show" title="Southwestern Exposition and Livestock Show">\n        Southwestern Exposition and Livestock Show\n       </a>\n       in Fort Worth is the oldest continuously running rodeo incorporating many of the state\'s most historic traditions into its annual events. Dallas hosts the\n       <a href="/wiki/State_Fair_of_Texas" title="State Fair of Texas">\n        State Fair of Texas\n       </a>\n       each year at\n       <a href="/wiki/Fair_Park" title="Fair Park">\n        Fair Park\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-statefair_339-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-statefair-339">\n         [337]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Texas_Motor_Speedway" title="Texas Motor Speedway">\n        Texas Motor Speedway\n       </a>\n       hosts annual\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/NASCAR_Cup_Series" title="NASCAR Cup Series">\n        NASCAR Cup Series\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/IndyCar_Series" title="IndyCar Series">\n        IndyCar Series\n       </a>\n       auto races since 1997. Since 2012, Austin\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Circuit_of_the_Americas" title="Circuit of the Americas">\n        Circuit of the Americas\n       </a>\n       plays host to a round of the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Formula_1" title="Formula 1">\n        Formula 1\n       </a>\n       World Championship\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-f1_340-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-f1-340">\n         [338]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       \xe2\x80\x94the first at a permanent road circuit in the United States since the\n       <a href="/wiki/1980_United_States_Grand_Prix" title="1980 United States Grand Prix">\n        1980 Grand Prix\n       </a>\n       at\n       <a href="/wiki/Watkins_Glen_International" title="Watkins Glen International">\n        Watkins Glen International\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94, as well as\n       <a href="/wiki/Grand_Prix_motorcycle_racing" title="Grand Prix motorcycle racing">\n        Grand Prix motorcycle racing\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/FIA_World_Endurance_Championship" title="FIA World Endurance Championship">\n        FIA World Endurance Championship\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/United_SportsCar_Championship" title="United SportsCar Championship">\n        United SportsCar Championship\n       </a>\n       races.\n      </p>\n      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-packed">\n       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 182px">\n        <div style="width: 182px">\n         <div class="thumb" style="width: 180px;">\n          <div style="margin:0px auto;">\n           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Cowboys_Stadium_full_view.jpg">\n            <img alt="" data-file-height="778" data-file-width="1166" height="120"
